dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: A city caught between the 12th century and the 20th; wher the medietal spires of the Tower of London compete for sp with office buildings of glass and steel. THE BULLDOZER rumbles through the city's afternoon traffi nearby COKSTRUCTION SITE. A high barrier surrounds the si which hangs A BANNER: JUBILEE LINE EXTENSION PROJECT: TAK INTO A NEW MILLENNIUM. The dezer stops by the banner, lowers its bucket to the ground. kevealed inside is a young passenger

dialogues.speaker: QUINN ABESCROMBY
dialogues.text: age 12, a“forward moving chap” just stalled on the border puberty. % hops out of the bucket with a nod to the DRIVE

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Cheers, Jake. Bookbag inone hand, some bags of fast-food in the other Quinn entess a door in the barrier marked SITE ENTRANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn walksthrough the site. Around him, WORKERS labor ov a lattice d girders. Huge CRANES lift material down a FIF FOOT WIDE WLE which leads to subway construction below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Site forewoman KAREN ABERCROMBY stands by a table, going a schematic. She's a working class matron in her 40s, ful of life, sturdy as the buildings she's helped construct. assistant, STUART, nudges her.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: There's your man. Karen looks up, sees Quinn approaching.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: What're you doin' without a hat?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: (Brandishing the food bags Bringin' you supper. Karen takes off her own hard hat, tosses it to Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ! Aw, mum...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Oh, "Mum" yourself. You know you can't be here without protection.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Don't believe it, Quinn. If she'd had protection, you wouldn't be here at all. i KAREN Watch it, mate... A WORKMAN calls from nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen! Jess needs you downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Can't it wait? We're just havin' our tea.

dialogues.speaker: WORKMAN
dialogues.text: He says it's urgent. Karen sighs, puts down the food.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Can I come down? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: No, love, they're still layin' in supports. (Kisses him on forehead.) ‘Nother time. Karen and Stuart head to the construction hole and enter cage-like ELEVATOR. With a metallic THUNK, the cage desce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, recently dug walls of soft earth and clotted clay. entire tunnel resonates with GRINDING SOUNDS coming from A TUNNEL BORING MACHINE ("TBM"): a steel cylinder the siz several pick-up trucks. Its cutting edge is a series of hydraulic rams that dig into the earth before it. At the moment, the TBM is stuck into the earth at the tunnel’s end. It bucks and grinds, like an animal trying free itself from a trap. Karen and Stuart approach the TBM's operator cab. Inside, JESS, a portly, choleric Irishmen, fiddles with the contr

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: All right, Jess?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Damn stuck is what I am. (Jimmies controls) You geniuses tol' me it was clay down here. I'm hittin' bloody bedrock. Karen and Stuart look at each other, confused.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Bollocks. (Climbs into the cab.) There's no bedrock for miles.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Well, maybe if Your Ladyship'd learn to read the charts. Karen disregards him; she works the hydraulic controls. T TBM WHIRRS, begins to unjam itself from the wall. Stuart inspects the debris nearby. It's then he notices A TRICKLE OF WATER running from the cut the TBM has made the wall. It's as if the machine has hit a water main. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Oy, Karen! Hold...

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: SLAMS into Stuart, knocking him backward. ,

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Stuart! Karen grabs his arm, pulls him up to the cab just as THE GUSH BECOMES A TORRENT, PUSHING THE TBM BACKWARD, lik cork forced from a bottle. KAREN, STUART AND JESS cling to the TBM cab for dear life Then, as quick as it came, the flood subsides. Soon, the only sound is the HISS of water STEAMING in the tunnel. aren rises unsteadily. She stares at what lies before the # LARGE HOLE, punctured in the wall by the TBM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unaware of the events below, Quinn sits reading a schoolb A distant CLANG splits the air. He looks up. The sound resonates from the spire of BIG BEN. It's 6:00 The famed clocktower is tolling in the coming night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding her flashlight, Karen steps into the hole, follow by Stuart and Jess. They can see their breath MIST with c

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Jesus! Water's bloody freezing.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Below freezing, mate. It's salt.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: What the hell's salt water doing...? All come to a mute halt on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Good Christ. REVEAL they are in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 feet high, but the dark makes it seem bigger. SHADOWS ODDLY SHAPED TRANSLUCENT STALACTITES AND STALAGMITES haun the space. Eeriest of all, however, are the PINPRICKS OF PHOSPHORESCENT LIGHT that dot the ceiling and walls. Thei dim, green glow make them look like subterranean stars. The three glance around nervously, their breath misting eerily before them.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Welcome to Wonderland, Alice. Stuart touches the glowing stuff on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Phosphorescent algae. What do you reckon?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Undersea cave maybe.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You daft? Ocean's miles from here.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Yes, your Lordship. And this country was under it.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What, ten thousand years ago?!

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: This must've gotten sealed off somehow. Karen and Stuart walk forward into the cavern. Jess, not so bold, takes a few steps back. SQUISH. His foot falls on something soft and wet. He look down at what he's stepped upon: A MASSIVE CABLE, stretching the length of the floor. Jess touches the thing with his boot. It's then he sees The Cable is covered with what seem to be HAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN AND STUART
dialogues.text: head into the cave. Karen trips on something. Stuart catc her. Karen turns her light to see on what she tripped on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BIZARRE FISH, prehistoric, almost alien looking, lies motionless on the ground. Stuart bends down to look at it STUART (cont'd) Jesus. Looks bloody primeval... Suddenly the fish THRASHES OUT, its spiny body nearly striking Stuart in the face. STUART (cont'd) Fuckin' hell! How can it be alive? THUD. A FAINT SOUND like a fist hitting an empty drum ech through the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: STUART, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jess, what are you on about? No answer. Karen flashes her light around. No sign of him

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Jess? Nothing. Karen and Stuart rise, calling Jess' name. Karen heads toward one end of the chamber. She comes to A CIRCULAR BOULDER set in the wall. 5-feet, shiny black. looks like an obsidian marble sunk halfway into the rock. STUART searches his end. ANOTHER THUD echoes through the cave, this one louder. He shines his light ahead...and freezes. For sprawled on ground before him is JESS. Eyes frozen open, blood trickling from his mouth. T "cable" he stepped on has WRAPPED ITSELF around his chest CRUSHING it like a tin-can.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Karen! Karen turns. The beam of her flashlight hits the surface the circular black boulder. THE COLOR OF THE BOULDER CHANGES: DEEP BLUE appears vertically on either end, widening so that all that's lef the black is m angry SLIT in the middle. It's not a barlder at all. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen finds herseif staring into an 4-FOOT EYE. Unnerving catlike; sky-blue iris; night-black pupil. She barely has time to react before SNAP! THE "CABLE" FLICKS OUT, SLAMMING Stuart against the wall with a sickening CRACK!

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Stuart!! She runs to him. But by that time, all hell's broken loos The dull echoing thuds grow louder, quicker... MOVEMENT ail around. The strange translucent stalactites shift one way...parts of the walls shift another...THE EN CAVERN SEEMS TO BE ALIVE WITH A TRANSLUCENT FLESH. The thuds are now DEAFENING AND RHYTHMICAL. The sound of massive HEARTBEAT.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: throws Strart over her back in a fireman's carry SNAP! ! The "Cable" STRIKES the ground nearby. Karen dodg with Stuart, makes for the cavern's exit. The "Cable" does not go after them. Rather, it WRAPS itse around TWO BOULDERS by the wall and drags them into an OPENING ir the cavern wall. Zn opening which we now see is a GIGANTIC MOUTH. And the cable is its massive TONGUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen runs with Stuart over her shoulder. She comes to a tunnel jumetion where SEVERAL WORKERS are busy.

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: Zeren, what's...?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Sreryone topside! NOW! In a burst adrenaline, she books for the elevator. The others folla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boulders start RATTLING within the mouth of the unsee Creature...like clicking flints trying to make a spark

dialogues.speaker: UNSEEN CREATURE
dialogues.text: begins to move out of its cavern into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fiery sunset is reflected in the WINDOWS of nearby shop Suddenly, an ALARM STARTS TO SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: BY QUINN
dialogues.text: The ground underneath the boy begins to TREMBLE. Quinn tr te rise, but is literally knocked off his feet as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLANG! Karen SLAMS the elevator door shut. She, Stuart an the other workers are packed in like sardines. She presse the controls. The elevator SLOWLY begins to climb. The tunnel’s SHAKING. In the distance, a terrible RATTLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workmen run for cover as girders fall around them. An ear piercing SCREECH OF METAL as a HUGE CRANES TOPPLES OVER.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Mum... ? Quinn looks toward the construction hole just as

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR CAGE
dialogues.text: rises from the hole. Quinn can see his mother and the oth caught in the cage. They're almost to safety when... THE RATTLING BELOW BECOMES DEAFENING.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Quinn, STAY BACK! STAY...

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE HOLE
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karer. and the others SCREAM as the elevator cage is CONS BY FIRE SO HOT IT INCINERATES THEM. The flaming elevator TOPPLES back into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: MUM
dialogues.text: Quinn runs to the collapsing elevator...then stops short. For something else is coming out to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: A_MAMMOTH WING
dialogues.text: painfully unfurls from the hole. Its flesh is withered, translucent from centuries without light. The sun shines through it, revealing a webwork of skeletal structure.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: can cniy watch, paralyzed, as

dialogues.speaker: A SECOND WING
dialogues.text: joins the first, torturously stretching, hoisting its mai body from the hole. As light hits the creature's skin, its color CHANGES. Lik ghost taking form, the flesh becomes a dark, rich BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: BN ENORMOUS SHADOW
dialogues.text: takes shape on the ground: a leviathan's silhouette of tw batlike wings and a gigantic, serpentine body.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATCRE'S HUGE EYE
dialogues.text: stares mezcilessly. For an instant, Quinn's REFLECTED in thing's cornea. Captured, like an insect in a glass.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: stares back in terror as the CREATURE'S SHADOW covers him blots out the remainder of light, taking us into

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS
dialogues.text: Silence. Tten, a hollow SOUND of wind rushing through sto

dialogues.speaker: A SLITTED, INHUMAN EYE
dialogues.text: fills frame its gold-flecked iris staring evilly at us. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK SLOWLY TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: It's only a mangy TABBY CAT, standing in the middle of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small] as a prison cell, made entirely of ancient rock. Dawnlight filters in from a slit in the wall. The Cat MEOWS, trying to get the attention of A MAN, asleep in a small cot. Dressed in fatigues, his fa turned from us, he does not seem about to get up. The Cat jumps up on a knickknack filled SHELF above the m head. It MEOWS again. The Man groans into his pillow.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Bugger off, Murphy. Undeterred, the Cat starts tapping a FRAMED PHOTOGRAPH wi its paw. It pushes the object over the edge of the shelf; the picture falls, landing a half-inch from the Man's hea We see it's a FAMILY PHOTO: Young Quinn standing with Kar The Man rolls over; we see his face. QUINN ABERCROMBY, now in his late 20s. A gentie, handsome face, one that's lived at great cost. Quinn picks up the photo, shakes it at the cat.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: One a these days, you're not gonna miss. Quinn puts the photo on the shelf, then gently grabs the

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then where you gonna be, eh? He carries the cat through the room. PLANTS hang from the wall; A GOLDFISH TANK in one corner; a CAGE with MICE in another. An old SHEEP DOG huddles by the door. Quinn walks to what passes for a "pantry": a small sterno burner with an assortment of ancient food tins.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They'll try you. Convict you. Hang you. He empties a packet of DRIED MILK into a bowl, fills it w water from a canteen, stirs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: il.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Probably won't even give you a last meal. He sets the bowl on the floor. Murphy hungrily laps the m The Sheep Dog by the door BARKS.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm not playin' favourites. Quinn grabs a partially burned BOOK from a rickety shelf. Then, dog in tow, he heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn walks through a narrow hallway of ancient rock. A BOY AND GIRL (JARED, 11, and BETH, 9), faces stained wi soot, race around the corner and nearly knock into him.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Oy oy oy, Jared. Keep it under fifty.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Sorry, Chief. The children continue on with their chase-game. Yawning, Quinn walks on past the door to

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL CHAPEL
dialogues.text: CHOIR MUSIC within, intoning a Catholic "Kyrie". We see t source of the music is A SHORTWAVE RADIO near the lectern The music ends, and an ANNOUNCER'S VOICE comes over the radio, speaking in ITALIAN.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OVER SHORTWAVE
dialogues.text: This is Vatican station, transmitting from temporary sanctuary in Sicilia... Quinn crosses himself as he walks by the chapel. He heads down a STONE STAIRCASE, which in turn opens out to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three acres enclosed by 30 FOOT HIGH STONE WALLS. It's a cross between a medieval village and a modern refugee cam PEOPLE dressed in threadbare clothes go about morning business. Some cook on grills fueled by SOLAR BATTERIES; get water from wells pumped by WINDMILLS. Others tend LIV STOCK roaming freely through the area. Everyone has the lean, hungry look of wartime refugees. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Quinn walks by, nodding hellos. The residents' replies ar all respectful: "mornin', Chief...up early, Chief..." He heads to the back of the yard where sits DAVE CREEDY -- 30s, red-haired, the runt of a short litte His accent is Cumbrian: a dialect that sounds like a Scot brogue run through a blender. He is cooking something over a coal fire as Quinn approac

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: There's your man.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Give us a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Shave. Creedy hands him a cup of tea. Quinn looks down, sees wha his friend is cooking: a frighteningly runny CHEESE SANDW

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's this then?

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: \ (Proudly) Fookin' cheese toastie.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: "Fookin' cheese," eh? (Inspects it.) From a cow or your toes?

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Try it an' see. _ (OFF Quinn's look) Oh, don't be "Mr. Picky-Poo". I's good this time, I put chives in it. Quinn regards the oozing mess, politely shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Since when'd you develop such a profoun'ly delicate palatte?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Since you found that damn cook book. Quinn rises, walks over to a set of STAIRS leading up to  13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In what is obviously a morning ritual, Quinn paces the WALKWAY that runs the top of the wall. He leans against the battlement, pulls out the book he to from his shelf. It's a technical manual titled: OXYGEN UN REPAIR. He starts to read. PULL BACK SLOWLY TO REVEAL he is standing on the walls of

dialogues.speaker: A MEDIEVAL NORMAN CASTLE
dialogues.text: Its ancient towers outfitted with solar panels, barbed wi and rusting guns. Its formidable rock walls scarred with huge black SCORCH MARKS. Wounds from a war with fire. PANNING AWAY from the castle, we see the country it inhab A BURNT, DESOLATE LANDSCAPE. Nothing standing much less living. The ground is SLICK BL SLAG - as if it were burned, melted, then licked clean. It stretches to an ever-grey sky which itself seems scorc SUPERIMPOSE: WARWICKSHIRE, ENGLAND. 2024 A.D.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF DISSOLVES
dialogues.text: over the barren domain. All seems lifeless until we come CHARRED TREE, standing like a sentinel on a hill overlook

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acres of color -- amber barley, green stalks of corn and alfalfa -- all reclaimed from the sea of black. People from the castle are busy HARVESTING. Some use deca bits of technology -- tractors, mowers, bailers. Others u jury~rigged equipment pulled by animals. Around the fields are several old WATER TENDERS ~- firetr with huge water tanks and hoses. MEN IN FIREFIGHTING GEAR atop them, armed with old rifles, guns, even crossbows. They scan the cloud-covered sky, watching for signs of li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of twenty STUDENTS aged four to twelve sit raptil watching Quinn, who is acting out a story for them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: (In a deep basso.) “Join me" the Black Knight says, "and we can end this destructive conflict together." (In a younger voice.) "I'll never join you!" The White Knight cries. "You killed my father!" But the Knight in Black only stares at him, stares through the buggy eyes of his black mask. And then he speaks the words that burn into our hero's heart forever. (In deep basso.) "No, Luke. JI am your father... The kids GASP at the revelation.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: You make that one up, Mr. Quinn?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I did. The Kids MUMBLE, impressed. Quinn winks at FAITH, 17, a s faced, ersatz school teacher who's barely through being a student. She blushes at Quinn's wink, turns to the kids.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Right then, loves. Time for maths. The Kids all protest.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, now. Thank the Fire Chief for comin' to storytell.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Not yet! One more! Please! Please! Faith can't get a word in. She looks at Quinn, who smiles

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: All right. Just one...

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: “The one about the shark"! "The Indiana man"! "The Lion Thingy"! BETH, a shy girl of eight, speaks from the back.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Tell us about The Ashley. Everyone goes quiet at the mention of that name. Long pau (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: You've heard that one plenty, Beth.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Not the way you tell it. The children stare at him. Quinn glances at Faith, who no Quinn gestures the kids in; they gather around him in a t circle, as if it were a campfire tale.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Listen then. You've heard how they found The Ashley in London town. Asleep in her cave, she was, in water colder 'n' ice. So long in darkness, her skin was clear as glass.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: How long she been there?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Thousands of years, Jared. Since the last ice age, even.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Was it magic she lived so long?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: No, Beth. Some reptiles, they hibernate in the cold. Scientists reckon she slept without eatin'. Without breathin. Waitin for warmth to wake her. And it did... With his hands he casts SHADOW OF A WINGED SHAPE on the w

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She rose into the sky that night, her skin turnin' the color of evening. Then like a ghost in the wind she disappeared. The hands' shadow vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone WATCHMAN stands atop the castle tower.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (VO)
dialogues.text: Oh, men looked for her, surely. Searched with machines from ocean to air. He scans the sky with an old coin-operated TOURIST BINOCU He puts coin slug after coin slug into it to keep it goin (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (VO)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But The Ashley was smart. She'd flown far into the Arab deserts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SENTRY squats in a stone hutch, watching the sky with a telescope.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (VO)
dialogues.text: .+.-and buried herself deep in the sands where nobody'd find her. Unseen by the man, something MOVES in the sky behind him.

dialogues.speaker: TWO AIRBORNE SHAPES
dialogues.text: huge yet nearly invisible. They BLEND IN with the smoky s chameleons turned the color of clouds.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: A year later, that whole desert starts shiftin' an' shakin’, as if the sands "emselves were alive. And then... Quinn's HAND SHADOWS imitate the ground exploding.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Up they came! Thousands of thousands of them. The Ashley's brood. Takin' to the air like locusts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV OF THE AIRBORNE CREATURE -- looking down through the cloud cover at the living fields below.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (VO)
dialogues.text: They fell first on the cities...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (VO)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then on the land. A WIND picks up. The charred tree trembles...then DISINTEGRATES INTO SWIRLING ASHES.  17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids look on expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: And then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the wind picks up, the animals in the Courtyard react. Horses skitter. Dogs begin to HOWL and BARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn suddenly stiffens, sensing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Watchman suddenly spies something.

dialogues.speaker: WATCHMAN
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ! He immediately turns the crank of an AIR RAID SIREN. Its piercing WHINE cuts through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several Firemen atop a Tender look up just as CRACK!! An ARC OF PHOSPHOROUS LIGHTNING STRIKES THE TENDE The vehicle EXPLODES in a cloud of superheated steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn gathers the students.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Jared, get ‘em to the cellars! Faith, you're with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The siren BLARES as Firemen on a second Tender desperatel try to extinguish the flames shooting up from the first.. Two other Firemen mount a decrepit WWII ANTI-AIRCRAFT GUN Terrified Farm Workers run SCREAMING for cover as... CRACK!! Another Phosphorous Arc strikes in the middle of corn field. The effect is like NAPALM -- A SWATH OF FIRE SCYTHING through the vegetation, consuming all in its pat  18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yard's in the grip of ordered panic. Like a city used war, PEOPLE run for pre-arranged protection of the castle towers as above the Watchman shouts

dialogues.speaker: THE NORTH FIELD
dialogues.text: Quinn and Faith race to the yard's end to a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rag-tag FIREHOUSE stocked with equipment that ranges fr modern day oxygen tanks to old hand-operated waterpumps. Quinn rushes to a TWO-WAY RADIO, flicks it on. CRIES and SOUNDS of a desperate battle are heard.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Justen? Talk to me!

dialogues.speaker: JUSTEN, (OS, OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Be're in the middle of the gobshite, Chief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUSTEN, 35, buff, firefighter, screams into a combat phon

dialogues.speaker: JUSTEN
dialogues.text: = got three Tenders down and two worms in the air... His voice is drowned out by the BLAM BLAM BLAM of the Ant Aircraft gm as it BLASTS its shells into the sky above. The shells EXPLODE, pocking the cloudy air with black bur But the SHAZES easily avoid the blasts. Barely visible, t slide into tie clouds like snakes slithering under stones

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Lesten to me: dig in an' hold your position. I'm comin' with back up. (No response.) Jweten? Only a STATICHISS from the radio. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Quinn looks up. Dave Creedy, Faith and TWENTY MEN AND WOM have joined him. They stare at Quinn in tense silence.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Suit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clipped, staccato CLOSE-UPS of Quinn and Co. suiting up. They're like knights getting ready for battle: A thick ALUMINIZED FIRECOAT is thrown over Quinn's shoulders...An asbestos GAUNTLET/GLOVE is thrust over his hand...A PULASKI (double bladed hoe and axe) slides into SEEATH on his back...A FIREMAN'S HELM fits over his head. Finally, a plexiglass VISOR snaps down over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The metal gates are thrown open...and Quinn CHARGES OUT, RIDING ATOP A HORSE, leading A RAGTAG FIRE BATTALLION on a range of vehicles: horse-dr FIRECARTS; LIGHT PUMPERS (mini-firetrucks the size of car a MACK AEPIAL (a truck witn a long extension ladder); and ALVIS SALAMANDER (armored 6-wheel ATV used for runway fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn pulls up short, looks down at the fields below. THE AREA IS AN INFERNO! Walls of THICK BLACK SMOKE rise i the air, backlit by orange flames. Above, a WWII MOSQUITO FIGHTER PLANE roars by, dumping RE FLAME RETARDANT FOAM over the fire. It does almost no goo Quinn speaks into a MIC set into his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Eddie, gimme the word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE STAX -- 30s, cockney, so huge he barely fits into t cockpit -- stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: We got us a firebox, Quinn. EDDIE'S POV -- FIELDS BELOW. All four sides of the field area are BURNING, creating a literal box. Within, PEOPLE (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: running, choking, looking for an escape. Blinded by the b smoke, they can't see a way out; they're like rats ina tr

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I count 30, maybe 40 people inside.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (0S)
dialogues.text: Any sign a the worms? Eddie sees a DISTANT SHAPE passing into the clouds above.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: They're circlin'.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Keep ‘em off our backs. We're gonna try a rescue.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (OS)
dialogues.text: You mental?! That wind shifts, you got a firestorm. Neo one's gonna make it...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Just do it! Quinn turns to his "troops", now pulling up to the hill.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen up! All companies, we're gonna take this bastard on the west side. I want a 20 meter firebreak in ten minutes. (Dismounts from his horse) Danny, fit a 10-K searchlight to the Mack. My signal, you turn it on. Quinn jumps atop the Salamander which Creedy drives.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bad news, Dave. You're with me.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: What're we doin'?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Walkin' in God's garden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battallim charges down, splitting left toward the wes "wall" of the fire box. The Salamander breaks right, straight to tie east "wall" where the fire burns fiercest  21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, the plane's 20-year old tailgunner, nervously locks loads his gun as Eddie removes a MICROPHONE from his pane He flicks a switch marked PA SYSTEM. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice BLARES over a LOUDSPEAKER on the plane's belly.

dialogues.speaker: AIRBORNE CREATURES
dialogues.text: Taking notice of the Mosquito. We hear Eddie's voice as T CREATURES HEAR IT: a series of HARSH, GRATING NOISES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy OPENS FIRE as the SHAPES start to head for the plane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane banks, leading the shapes away from the fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire companies are attacking the firewall: spraying water, using the pulaskis to create a firebreak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Salamander speeds toward a WALL OF FLAME. Quinn stand atop the vehicle, manning an artillery sized FIRE HOSE GU Creedy sticks his head out the window.

dialogues.speaker: DON'T YOU SLOW DOWN
dialogues.text: Creedy mumbles a prayer, then FLOORS the accelerator. The firewall GROWS till it fills his entire line of sight. TOP OF SALAMANDER -- Quinn sprays the fire, creating a br

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inside of the "firebox" is a maelstrom of BLACK-SMOFE peppered with RED HOT CINDERS. One can't see 5 feet ahead

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: It's gonna be hell findin' anybody!

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Drive slow. They'll find us... Quinn points the nozzle out and begins SPRAYING water ina wide, slow arc into the smoke-choked fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN and several CHILDREN struggle in the darkness, unab to see, barely able to breath. There seems to be no way o Suddenly, a SPRAY OF WATER pierces through the thick hot smoke, sprinkling their faces like a cool benediction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn keeps spraying as he calls into the black void.

dialogues.speaker: ANYONE THERE
dialogues.text: His eyes are tearing from the smoke as he scans the darkn For a long moment, there is nothing. But then, through the clouds, they come. PEOPLE, coughing choking, drawn from the inferno by the life-giving water.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold on to the truck! They cling to the truck, which leads them through the dar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH! A PHOSPHOROUS ARC cuts through the clouds like horizontal lightning. The Mosquito barely avoids it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy looks out the window, shouts to him. Eddie sees that right engine is on fire. He switches frequencies on the m (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn...I got a flame out on number two. We gotta call it a day... EXT. SKY BY MOSQUITO - Day The Mosquito banks away, toward the safety of the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STRING OF PEOPLE now hold on to the Salamander for dear life. But it's a case of the blind leading the blind.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: I can't see a bloody thing...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Settle down. (To Radio) Faith! How's my fireline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The firemen have created a 20 meter BREAK in the fire wal It literally looks like a door out of hell. Faith speaks into her radio.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Right and ready, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: That 10K rigged? Faith looks up to brigade lieutenant DANNY GOODWIN, age 3 who stands atop a THIRTY FOOT LADDER that extends from th Mack. A SEARCHLIGHT has been set upon it.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Ready, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Light ‘em up. Danny throws a switch. The searchlight FLICKERS ON EXT. FIELDS - By SALAMANDER - DAY The LIGHT PIERCES THROUGH THE SMOKE LIKE A KNIFE. A beaco to guide the Salamander out. Creedy LAUGHS. He drives toward the light. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But then Quinn hears a BOY shouting behind him.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Mr. Quinn! My sister...she let go... Quinn calls to Creedy.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Keep it movin', Dave! Quinn jumps off the back, heads toward the fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV OF AIRBORNE CREATURES -- flying back toward the field

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Firemen rush to help the survivors into every vehicle gentle WHOOSH of a breeze is heard. Faith feels it first.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: (Nervously, to walkie-talkie) Quinn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn picks up a barely conscious GIRL lying on the groun

dialogues.speaker: FAITH, (OS, OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Winds changin'. The fire's gonna flare... His radio SPUTTERS. Quinn taps it. No good. IT'S DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Quinn? Can you hear me? No response. Unsure of whether Quinn knows of the danger, she runs into the fields in search of her chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his belt, Quinn pulls a FIRE SHELTER -- a floorless aluminum pup tent. He spreads it over himself and the gir He secures the edges with his boot tips and gloved hands.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Glynnis...we're gonna close our eyes an' stay flat. When I count three, you hold your breath. Can you do that for me? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Girl nods, terrified. The roar of wind gets louder.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith feels the wind. She pulls out her emergency shelter

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Two... Faith tries to assemble it, but lacks Quinn's experienced calm. Her hands shake, costing her precious seconds.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Three. Quinn and the Girl breath deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! A GUST OF WIND sends fire FLARING OVER THE FIELDS It washes like a tsunami over Quinn's emergency shelter..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and STRIKES FAITH FULL ON as she tries to get into her shelter. So quick, she never knew what hit her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girl clutches Quinn as the fire FLARES over the shelt shaking and roaring as if it were a living thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Salamander drives in. Danny's at the wheel, Creedy ma the water gun, spraying the fiery ground before him. He s Quinn's shelter, sprays the area around it.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Quinn! Quinn emerges from the shelter, the young girl in his arm

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Move it! We got worms comin'! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: (Handing girl to Danny) Where's Faith? Danny shakes his head. Quinn stares a second, unbelieving He turns, Starts to go look for the girl. Creedy stops hi

dialogues.speaker: FORGET IT, QUINN
dialogues.text: Quinn struggles; but Creedy is much stronger than he look He pulls Quinn back to the Salamander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHADOWS OF TWO WINGED FORMS pass over the land, flying no towerd the burning fields.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (O.S., OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Chief, they're comin' down. You want a counterattack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn looks at the blackened, exhausted faces of his Fire

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: They'll just go airborne again. Hit us from the sky. Quinn stares out the window, his eyes weary, almost lifel

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Pull back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battallion of fire vehicles beats a hasty retreat sou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire subsides. Once green fields are now nothing but Through smoke, we see SILHOUETTES OF TWO HUGE WINGED SHAP landing on the field. We don't get a full view of them; j CLOSE SHOTS of PARTS OF THEIR BODIES seen through the smo A CLAW/LEG -- the stunted limb of a beast not built for w WINGS -- veined, leathery, batlike. Folding silently agai (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A GIANT TORSO -- 30-feet of slick, reptilian scales. The scales are the color of clouds. But as they near the char earth, they CHANGE HUE, turning the COLOR of the dark gro Finally -- and perhaps worst of all -- A HUGE MOUTH enter frame. Lips curled in the perpetual smile of a predator. Its teeth are like rows of sword-length RAZOR SHARP NEEDL A CABLE-LIKE TONGUE unwinds from its maw. It sweeps over charred ground and begins to rake in piles of ash. The mouth FEEDS ON THE ASH. Its needle-teeth MESH togethe creating a kind of filter which strains bits not complete burned: pieces of metal, wood and human bone. As the mouth works its meal, something falls from its lip The remains of Faith's scorched FIRE SHELTER. A RATTLING SOUND is heard, followed by a short BURST of PHOSPHOROUS FLAME. The fire consumes the shining tent, reducing the last remnant of the girl to ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lit by solar-powered floodlights, it looks like an island caught between dual voids of black sky and black earth.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (OS)
dialogues.text: Look, if my conscience could change the math, it would...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A council of Firemen -- Creedy, Danny, Eddie among them - argue around a long rusted table. Quinn sits at the head, examining a CHALKBOARD filled with numeric calculations.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: But it's plain subtraction, all right? With those fields gone, we're not gonna have enough food for winter.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It's only August. We can still lay ina new crop...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: With those worms out there?

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: They'll leave once they've fed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: That could be months.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: You the bloody Almanac now?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No, Creedy, I just got bloody eyes...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: (Calmly) All right, cut it down. The group shuts up. They stare at Quinn, who scratches recalculations on the board with a piece of chalk.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now we still got the hydroponics. I can convert the main hall into a greenhouse. If we cut to half-rations...trade for seed with Edinburgh... Looks up at them.) It won't be a feast, lads, but it'll get folks through to March.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: That's it, then? The grand solution? Quinn looks at him. Eddie shakes his head bitterly.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: You got a problem with it?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Nooo. I think it's rosey-fuckin'-doo. (To the others.) We burrow like rats. Starve through another winter...

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Eddie...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: ...meanwhile, Ashley squats in London, hatching her eggs. Come spring, her kids can just burn us out again...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: It's not all right, Chief! HOW LONG WE

dialogues.speaker: GOTTA PUT UP WITH THIS
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Quinn sees the same question reflected in each of his firemen's eyes. When Eddie speaks again, it's a challenge

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm for goin' to London. Quinn shakes his head. Eddie turns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, there's buildings still standin' there. Food. Medicine. If we knock out Ashley's nest, it's all ours...

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: We can't even handle the two worms here. You wanna pick a fight with their ma?!

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I'd rather go out fightin' than starvin'.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: An' take the whole castle with you? {Shakes his head.) We stick to the strategy.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (Icily) Same strategy that got Faith killed? The room goes dead quiet; Eddie's clearly crossed a line.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I say we put it to a vote. (To Quinn) Or you too much of a big girl's blouse? Quinn remains composed. He rises, chalkboard in hand.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: All right. I can see there's a bit of division on the subject. (Starts walking around table) But let's not start callin' names, yeah? Least we owe each other is the courtesy of debating this like Englishmen... Quinn wheels round and BREAKS THE CHALKBOARD ON EDDIE'S H The firemen are taken aback. Quinn stands over Eddie. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your first job's to this community. Not your damn pride. You wanna play buckaroo, join another brigade. Quinn tosses the broken chalkboard down to him, then leav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn feeds his fish with GRUBS from a jar of earth. A KNOCK on the door. Creedy enters, carrying a plate fill with a scary looking potato. Quinn regards it dubiously.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: What's this then?

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Fookin' spud. (Sets it down) I simmered it in gravy; gave it a nice bouquet. Earthy. Kin' a mooshroomy...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Almost fungus-y.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Just eat it. Quinn smiles, takes the plate. Creedy sits on the bed; he's visibly on edge.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: You been havin' conversations. Creedy tries to put it delicately.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: There's some thinkin'...maybe Eddie's right. Quinn shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Quinn, he's got a big mouth, but he's also got a point. We can't last here forever. Sooner or later, we gotta make a stand...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: We are makin' a stand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Quinn goes to the window, gestures out.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at it. Twenty years ago, you couldn't see the sky, there was so many of 'em. Ten years, you couldn't lay ina crop. Now we can. What's that tell you? Creedy rubs his eyes. They've been through this before.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can outlast ‘em, Dave. Every year, there's less to burn, less ash for 'em to eat. They'll starve eventually. We just gotta hang on till...

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Till when? You don't know.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I know Ashley. We go stirrin' her up, we'll be diggin’ graves for every man, woman an' child around. (Shakes his head.) I'm not partial to doin' that duty again. Creedy glances at a faded 20th-century POSTCARD on the wa a PHOTO OFA CASTLE with inscription: PEMBREY CASTLE.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: That was eight years ago, mate. You can't keep blamin' yourself... Quinn suddenly stops, seeing something through the window BRIGHT LIGTS playing in the distance, slowly approaching. SHOUTS are Zeard in the hall outside. Danny runs in.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Wehicles comin'! (Nervously, to Quinn.) %E looks like a raiding party. Quinn and Geedy exchang= glances, then head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alive with mmmotion. Quinn's Firemen run along the battlements, taking positions with guns, crossbows, etc. Armed with arold rifle, Quinn climbs up to the battlement He stares owover the walls. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WHITE LIGHTS dart wildly in the darkness over the ridge, accompanied by the distant ROAR OF VERY BIG ENGINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOTS of WHEELS and TREADS of some seriously HEAVY VEHICLES. Chewing up and spitting out chunks of blackened ground as they grind toward the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn paces the battlements, commanding like a general.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Danny, take B company to the south wall. Eddie! Get that goddam howitzer up here! The ENGINE ROAR gets louder; the white lights closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Watchman squints into his Tourist Binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a LICENSE PLATE attached to a yet unseen vehicle. It read NEW HAMPSHIRE. "LIVE FREE OR DIE". PULL BACK TO REVEAL it is attached to AN ABRAMS TANK. 46 tons. God's wrath in metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they pull a Howitzer into position on the wall, Quinn Creedy get a glimpse of what's coming.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Say goodnight to the folks, Gracie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGHT HEAVILY ARMORED VEHICLES follow the Abrams: BRADLEY ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIERS bristling with guns; AML MINI- TANKS outfitted with HARPOON LAUNCHERS; and finally, a sc like MOWAG MISSILE CARRIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firemen look at each other nervously. They're utterly outgunned. Quinn tries to keep them from panicking. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Easy, lads. We still got height on 'em. THE VERICLES' ROAR becomes deafening. In the blinding gla of their headlights, they look like a herd of metal monst Quinn takes a position at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fire by file on my signal! THE VEHICLES keep coming. A WHIRRRR from the APCs. ARTILL GUNS SPROUT from wells at their top, aiming at CREEDY, who nervously mans the Howitzer. It's like facing down a bazooka with a water pistol.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Steady!! THE ABRAMS TANK turns its massive turret gun toward THE FIREMEN, holding position, keeping one eye on QUINN, who raises his arm, waiting till the enemy's in ra

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Steady!! His arm is about to come down when suddenly THE VEHICLES STOP. That quickly. All noise fades into ech QUINN doesn't move. A long, eerie silence follows, broken THE ABRAMS TANK. A metallic CH¥-CHK-CHK is heard from its top-hatch. The hatch opens up with a heavy CLUNK! A scarred LEFT HAND appears, holding a PDW SUBMACHINE GUN An equally scarred RIGHT HAND appears, holding a CIGAR. The two arms work together to pull up their massive owner

dialogues.speaker: DENTON VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: 30s, handsome, an American Achilles. The classical featur of a Roman general; the 1000-yard stare of a Vietnam vet. He surveys the landscape impassively, lights the cigar wi Zippo, takes a drag, then passes judgment. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: (\ What...a...dump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn hears the man's accent, looks over at Creedy.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Americans?

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN, (OS)
dialogues.text: You by the Howitzer! Creedy turns, sees Van Zan is talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, you, Sparky. Who's in charge?

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: What he call me?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Shhh...

dialogues.speaker: I AIN' NO FOOKIN' "SPARKY"
dialogues.text: ‘ QUINN Shut your gob! Quinn pulls Creedy back. Beat. He yells back at Van Zan.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's your business? Van Zan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Real estate.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, the market's a bit depressed right now. I advise lookin' elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Relax, bro. We're here to make friends. Van Zan lays down his gun, jumps to the ground, raises hi empty hands in a sign of "truce". Long beat. Quinn considers, then calls out to him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Keep your vehicles back. I'll meet you at the gate. Van Zan begins walking toward the castle. Quinn gives Creedy his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He tries anything, you know what to do. It's plain from Creedy’s face he hasn't any idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn nods to a Firemen. The man opens the gate, revealin Van Zan, standing casually on the other side. The two men look at each other a moment, sizing one another up.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: I'm told in Medieval days, two Kings'd meet, they'd exchange the kiss of peace. (Extends his hand.) I'll settle for a handshake.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Back then, they shook hands to see if there were weapons up their sleeves. Quinn takes Van Zan's hand. Not as much a greeting as a method of immobilization. For a moment, neither man lets

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's your game, mate? You tradin'’ or attackin'?

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: That depends on you, "Mr. Buddy".

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I ain't your "buddy".

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2ZAN
dialogues.text: And I ain't your "mate". But that doesn't mean we can't come to an agreement. (Gestures back to his vehicles.) My boys are kinda tired. Long trip, bad food. We were hopin' for accommodations.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: What's it worth to you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan removes a PACK from his shoulder, hands it to Qui It's filled with army issue C-RATIONS.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: 100 pounds of C-rations. Plus freeze- dried ice-cream for the kids. Quinn considers a moment, then tosses the bag back at him

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I think you can do better. Van Zan remains pleasant, but shows a flash of teeth as h tosses the bag back at him.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: You know...you're really not ina position to negotiate. Van Zan nods in the direction of his mini armada. Quinn takes it in stride, throws the bag back at him.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I reckon I'm doin' all right. Quinn nods up to his armed men lining the battlements. Van Zan smiles, knowing they're even. He holds out the ba this time a little more congenially.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Okay, friend. 150 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: 200. And that's just for one night.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Done. Quinn goes to take the bag. Van Zan grabs his hand.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you don't get any ice cream. Quinn allows himself a smile. He takes the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan's armada enters through the gates into  37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Residents line up to gawk at the new arrivals. Quinn and Firemen watch, their weapons at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: "Denton Van Zan"?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: That's what he calls himself.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Sounds like a blood disease. They ship all that shite over?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Transport plane. Crash-landed off the coast.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What the hell are they doing here? Quinn is silent. He just stares at

dialogues.speaker: THE COURTYARD
dialogues.text: Van Zan sits atop the moving tank, waving to the people w all of the confidence of Patton entering Palermo.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Evenin'...nice to be here...thanks for watching... SEVERAL KIDS touch his tank in fascination.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Scuse me. The kids look up. Van Zan stares down at them coldly.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do I play with your tank? Beat. The kids all shake their heads.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then don't mess with mine. Scram. And they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creedy watches Van Zan's MEN unpack their vehicles. They' scarred, hardened folk who've spent much time in the fiel (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He netices a shrimpy 16-year old KID unloading his gear f a truck. The boy has NO LEGS. Just tied off stumps at his hips. None of his comrades make any attempt to help him. Moved by the sight, Creedy walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Need a hand there, lad? The Kid draws a huge SHOTGUN from a sheath on his back.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Suck my dick. Creedy goes crimson. A deep LAUGH is heard behind him. Creedy turns to see GID -- black, 30s, seven-feet of post-apocalyptic rasta man.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: He fine by himself, mon. Da Pope don't like charity. Creedy looks back at the kid, who shall now be known as

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: "The Pope"? Before Creedy can say more, the SOUND OF ROTORS is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WASH OF WIND AND LIGHT comes over the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, you all might want to move back a bit... The crowd rushes to get out of the way of A Blackhawk "" HELICOPTER, descending from the heavens. I nestles down into the middle of the Courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Aw, spiffy... But his attitude changes when the pilot appears at the do COLLEEN BEANE -- 20s, small build, enigmatic eyes. Her perpetual dress is a unisex flight-suit and combat boots.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: What took you, Beane? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: (Laughs) What took me? Your coordinates, my man. They almost took me to France. (Puts her arm on his shoulder) Not that I couldn't use the vacation... The two walk off. Quinn finds himself staring at her. Not because it's a female pilot; rather, because it's one of those times when he can't help himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creedy walks with Van Zan, who carries The Pope back-to-b via a harness. Pope hangs from the man like a weird knaps

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: I take it you watch his back.

dialogues.speaker: THE POPE
dialogues.text: No, Sparky. He watches mine. PAN OVER TO Colleen and Quinn, walking behind them. Colle looks around the area, inspecting the castle walls.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: I've never seen a base like this. It pretty secure?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: We moved into here after the other buildings were destroyed. The Normans built their castles to last.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Normans?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Norman dynasty. Y'know, Richard the Lionheart.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: He your Fire Chief?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Ah...no. He was a king back in the...

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: I was kidding. Quinn looks at her, surprised. He chuckles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: That's good. You got me. You didn't look like someone who'd do that.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Looks can be deceiving.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Names are a bit more straightforward. (Offers his hand.) Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Colleen. They take each other's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunking down in the straw, The Pope unlatches his guitar case. Colleen checks out one of the horses, patting its n Quinn watches her from the door as Creedy talks with Van

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: »+-Clean up afterwards. An' no funny stuff with the livestock.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: We'll try to contain ourselves. Creedy goes to the door. Quinn turns to Colleen.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Sleep well. Van Zan claps a friendly/warning hand on Quinn's shoulder

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: We'll sleep light. Quinn smiles thinly.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: By a stunning coincidence, so will we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weapons armed, Quinn and the firemen stand post on the ba ments, tensely watching for any treachery from the Yanks.  41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: — Van Zar looks through the slats. He smiles at The Pope.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Think they know what they're in for? The Pope smiles back. He pulls a ROCKET PROPELLED GRENADE LAUNCHER (RPG) from his case. It gleams balefully in the lantern light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises in the smoke filled sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn slumped asleep by the battlement, rifle in his hand Creedy nudges him.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: The, ah, Lord of the Americas desires your presence in the Courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: ( Hah? Quinn looks down. At the end of the courtyard, Van Zan si surrounded by Quinn's firemen. They've put down there weapons and listen intently to him, like kids at a camp f QUINN (cont'd) Bloody shaggin' hell...

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: You might wanna talk to him, Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: He says he's a dragonslayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jared and Beth play with Van Zan's discarded cigar butts.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: No no no, it's like this... (Takes a drag, imitates Van Zan.) ( “What a dump!" (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Jared, get that outa your mouth! Quinn grabs the cigar as he walks hurriedly by with Creed CREEDY © ..-he says they killed ten of ‘em in Chicago. Ten! Gideon the rasta man passes by.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: Top a da mohnin'.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Jah-love... (To Quinn) They practically cleaned out Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan sits on his tank, holding court to the firemen. T Pope sits below him, an obnoxious court jester.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: .»..the worst? Hell, I'd have to say...

dialogues.speaker: THE POPE
dialogues.text: Grand Canyon.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. That was a turdsucker...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Oy! Beowulf! Quinn approaches him. Beat. The two eye each other.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm told you're a scrapper. Beat. Van Zan removes a pair of MIRROR LENSE SUNGLASSES f his pocket, puts them on as if he was a celebrity.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: My associates and I have been known to “scrap” things from time to time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn and the inner circle of firemen sit at the council table. Facing them are Van Zan and The Pope, both wearing sunglasses and looking very much the cool customers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: A hundred and fifty?!

dialogues.speaker: THE POPE
dialogues.text: One fifty three to be exact.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Keep a score-card, do ya?

dialogues.speaker: THE POPE
dialogues.text: (Deadpan) We have a newsletter.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Wait a sec, Rambo: last I knew, it took eight fighter jets just to kill one...

dialogues.speaker: VAN Z2AN
dialogues.text: Sure. In the old days. (Rises, begins to pace.) First we used fighters. Then nerve gas. Then nukes. Hell, we lost more people to collateral damage than we ever did to the snakes. It's no miracle they overran us. He's come to the head of the table. He stares at Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But they can be killed, folks. Cleanly. Easily. No stress, no mess. Just takes a little bit a "this"... (Taps his head. And a little bit a "this". (Holds out his “fuck you" finger.) Silence. The firemen look to their leader for a response. Quinn stands up, stares at Van Zan a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: How much a "this"... (Holds up his own "fuck you" finger) ...to get rid a the two we got here? Van Zan looks at Quinn's finger challengingly.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: How much you got? Beat. Quinn nods at his council. One by one, each of his raises their middle finger. A forest of fuck yous sprouts Van Zan smiles. He likes that. He likes it a lot.  44.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (0S)
dialogues.text: First off, you have to know your enemy. REVEAL Van Zan addressing an assembly of ALL OF QUINN'S FIREMEN. He talks with the energy of a powerbroker.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Worms, snakes, dragons. You deal with ‘em every day; but what do you know about ‘em? He picks out one tow-headed young ROOKIE FIREMAN

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You: Jughead. The Rookie nervously stands, as if he was in class.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE
dialogues.text: Well, they...they're a kind a dinosaur...

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Pre-dinosaur, Einstein. Cambrian species. Crawled out of a much scarier swamp than you ever did. (To the others.) Anyone tell me why they eat ash? All are silent. Finally it's Quinn who speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: They can only digest pure carbon. Van Zan raises his eyebrow, mock-impressed.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: So how come we never found any fossils?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: They burnt each other for food. You're not tellin' me anything new, mate. Van Zan smiles a challenging smile.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' you the big picture...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNK! A GIANT DRAGON-HIDE SCROLL is unrolled down the ai (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They're like locusts. On it has been painted A SERIES OF PICTURES, like the Bay tapestry, showing the life cycle of dragons.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every 50,000 years, they come up, breed and burn, eat and starve. Van 2an walks down the aisle, talking to the castle RESID who are crammed into the hall trying to get a look.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They didn't just kill the dinosaurs, folks. They're responsible for every Major die-off on this planet. Ash they threw in the air caused nuclear winters that started the freakin' ice-ages. PAN OVER the standing room crowd. Quinn watches at back.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, a few of 'em survived between cycles. Probably gave rise to the legends.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: So you don't put stock in the myths then?

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: What, that they're the "scourge of God"? (Laughs. ) No. We make the myths. He looks at a stained glass depiction of the CREATION OF

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As for the "Scourge of God" -- you're talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just Van Zan and Quinn now, sharing a bottle of Glenfiddi

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: So now you wanna "scourge" for us?

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Buddy, I can have you sowin' crops by Monday and eatin' pretty all winter.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Just what do you get out of it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ven Zan looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: I've seen a 1000 communities like yours, Quinn. Scared. Starving. Fighting a war of attrition till the snakes go away. (Turns to him.) Well, they won't. Not till we've pulverized, excised and atomized them off our God-given planet. Van Zan walks to the table, an odd light in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See, what people don't realize is...this ain't no disco. (Smiles .) It's a motherFUCKIN' HOLY WAR! BAM! He BANGS the table so hard it nearly cracks.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: So that's it, eh? You want recruits.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: You got a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: What I got is 300 people lookin' for protection. You want to help ‘em, fine. But I'll not have 'em be fodder for a personal fuckin' Jihad...

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Come off it, Chief. We all got scores to settle with 'em.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I've learned to live with it.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: No offense, but I think you've learned to take it up your Limey butt. Beat. Van Zan's crossed that line. Quinn rises, comes fac face with him, deadly polite.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: It's a “British butt". An' I'm not in the habit of takin' anything there. Includin' your General Patton attitude. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: If it wasn't for Patton, you people'd be speaking German.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: If it wasn't for my people, you wouldn't be speakin' English. Tense moment...which is broken by Van Zan's easy grin.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Least we can understand each other. (Offers his hand) Do this one job together. If you like the collaboration...we'll talk about others. Quinn stares into Van Zan's eyes. Is he making a deal wit savior? Or a devil? A moment of decision. Quinn spits into his own palm. Van Zan smiles, does likew Their hands come together with a SLAP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan's militia gears up.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (VO)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four easy steps to this, people. Get it right or get a priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan addresses Quinn's Firemen.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: One: knock 'em outta the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen attaches MISSILES to the copter's fuselage.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (VO)
dialogues.text: They may be hotshit up there... Nearby, Gideon and TWO MEN assemble bizarre-looking BODY HARNESSES. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (VO)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +..but they're jackshit down here.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: Two: stop their flame... He picks up some stones, shakes them. It sounds like the same RATTLE the dragons make.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They rattle rocks in their throats to spark their phosphorous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN-SIZE HARPOONS are fit in LAUNCHERS on the AML MINITAN

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN, (VO)
dialogues.text: If you hold the bastards down, then hit ‘em in the gut... HUGE SHELLS are loaded into the Abrams Tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan tosses pebbles onto the dirt floor like dice.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: They'll spit 'em up every time. Which brings us to "three". (Taps bottom of his throat.) Gland that secretes their napalm is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pope slides a rocket bolt into the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN, (VO)
dialogues.text: Put a good-size grenade down there... The bolt locks into place with a sinister CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: -..and you're all ready for step "four".

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: What might that be? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Van Zan smiles evilly. As if to say: "you'll see".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan's militia moves out, flanked by Quinn's firemen. FLAGS fly from each vehicle: the original U.S. flag of 17 A PICTURE OF A SNAKE with the logo: DON'T TREAD ON ME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vehicles are strategically placed on what looks like a ba Mmoonscape. BURN SHADOWS of a once lush forest are etched the stone. The only sound is the fluttering of flags. FIND Quinn, talking to his men.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: -..we stay outa the perimeter till the order comes. Last thing I need is one a you tossers gettin' dusted.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Where you gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Denton wants him in the chopper. Quinn turns to see Colleen approaching.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I don't take orders from your boss, lass.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: That's okay. You can take ‘em from me.

dialogues.speaker: FIREMEN
dialogues.text: Ooococoh. . Quinn blushes despite himself. Colleen smiles.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: You want to see how this works, right? Beat. Quinn looks up toward Van Zan, who stands on a hill nearby. The American speaks into a headset.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: All units, this is Good Shepherd. Let's get ready for the revival...  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan's men throw DARK COLORED NETTING over their vehic camouflaging themselves in the black blasted landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gideon and TWO MEN secure their "harnesses" in the hold. Quinn belts up in the copilot seat, Colleen next to him. casts a glance at her. She notices.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I was just thinkin'. I've only seen you in that jumpsuit. I was wonderin' if you'd like some other clothes.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Your straps're on wrong. She moves to help him.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ever been up in one of these?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Bh. No. I've just flown planes.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Well, this is a lot different. (Fastens his buckle.) Whatever you do, don't touch anything. QUINN ; You're makin' that a tad difficult. He smiles. She blushes despite herself, clips his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan goes to the driver's seat. There sits GOOSH -- st hippy-like demeanor, zapped out eyes. Imagine Dennis Hopp APOCALYPSE NOW as a disc jockey.

dialogues.speaker: GOOSH
dialogues.text: What's the theme?

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Hard-core. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GOOSH
dialogues.text: Awesome. Goosh nods. He presses a couple of buttons on his console Several INDUSTRIAL SIZED AMPLIFIERS lift up from the top the carrier. Van Zan picks up a mic from the vehicle. His voice blares

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentleman, are we ready to rock?! Van Zan's soldiers give a ROUSING CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: YEAH
dialogues.text: The Englishmen look at each other nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AR WHEEL on a CD PLAYER turns, CLICKS into place. A HARD-CORE INDUSTRIAL SONG blasts from the speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn looks at Colleen, who flips circuit breakers overhe

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Sound lures 'em in, screws with their hearing. They don't like music.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: And it takes our mind off dis crazy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan is doing a passionate "air guitar” duet with The Pope, who uses his RPG as a guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creedy's face falls; the sanity quotient ain't lookin' hi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: We are so fookin' fooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blackhawk leaps into the air like a dog off its chain The music rises with it. A clarion call to battle...

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF DISSOLVES
dialogues.text: Through a cloud-choked sky, moving far, far away. The mus becomes faint...fainter...until it's a whisper in the win But then, just as it's about to become inaudible

dialogues.speaker: UNSEEN AIRBORNE CREATURE
dialogues.text: Coming from the opposite direction. We hear the music as CREATURE HEARS IT: as sharp, disjointed SCREECHES. The thing banks through a cloud toward the sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLIP appears on a RADAR SCREEN. The RADAR OPERATOR spea

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Good Shepherd, this is Oracle. We have a visitor to the revival...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man's voice is heard over the headset.

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: 5 klicks, forty degrees North Northeast.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Seraph, you copy that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen responds into her radio.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Seraph copies. We're at two thousand fee and ready to dance.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Dress the angels. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Colleen makes a handsign to Gideon and his friends. They begin to put on their metal "harnesses".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its nearly invisible SHAPE slips easily through the heave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blip on screen has moved closer to the center.

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Visitor is three klicks and closing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gideon and his cohorts insert themselves into the harness BRACES over their legs; METAL RODS along their chests; RI attached to their stomachs; PACKS on their back.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Angels are ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan scans the sky with his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Send 'em out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn watches, perplexed, as Gideon goes to the CARGO PASSENGER DOOR on the right. Gideon flashes a smile.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: You wanna dance wid da Devil, you gotta walk wid da Lord... He opens the cargo door. Then, with the grace of a cliff diver, he LEAPS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gideon falls, his two pals right behind him. Bodies rigid they hurtle zoward the ground like knives. Gideon mouths a countdown, then grabs the two METAL RODS run along his chest. What follows is instantaneous: He flips out his hands and the metal rods... His legs do a SCISSOR KICK; the leg braces lock with a SN (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His backpack OPENS...A BLOOM of fabric appears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Firemen watch, slack jawed.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You got to be joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen smiles wryly at Quinn's surprise.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Good Shepherd, the angels are flying. EXT. SKy - DAY

dialogues.speaker: THE HARNESSES HAVE OPENED INTO BIZARRE-LOOKING HANGLIDERS
dialogues.text: The invention could be out of a Da Vinci drawing; the ima out of a religious painting. For the three men GLIDING ea through the air look literally like angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blip has gotten closer to the center of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Visitor is two kilometers and closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLICK of a tail is seen; a GLANCE of a leathery wing.

dialogues.speaker: VAN Z2AN
dialogues.text: Aerial units, lock and load.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen flips the safety of her Armament Fire Control Swi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gideon removes what looks like a staff from his stomach. see it is an incredibly LONG RIFLE. A CANNISTER WITH SPIK (a "Sonic Grenade") is fit snugly into the barrel. THE TWO OTHER HANGLIDERS (ARCHANGELS #1 & #2) follow suit  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blip on screen is closer...closer...

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: One kilometer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn sees something's emerging from the clouds ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blip enters the radar's inner circle.

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: 21l units...visitor has arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And like a child's nightmare, it emerges from the clouds

dialogues.speaker: 2_DEAGON
dialogues.text: Its huge body is dwarfed by the span of its massive wings VESTIGIAL LEGS line its scaly torso, their claws opening closing reflexively. If Giger were to mate with the Broth Grimm, this is the abomination they'd spawn.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN, (0.S., OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: We got us an Adolescent. Worker Class. Fifteen meters and ready for a fight. Van Zan's face is impassive as a mountain.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Tet's give it some religion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen presses the ARMAMENT FIRE switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MISSILES burst forth, tearing through the air toward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: which ares ard avoids the first missile. The second DETONATES bereath its tail. No damage; just annoyance. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The creature rears back like an airborne cobra. A RATTLIN is heard from its throat... And a BLAST OF PHOSPHOROUS LIGHTNING BURSTS FROM ITS MOUT

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACKHAWK
dialogues.text: swerves, barely missing getting fried. It arcs, speeding away from the monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn looks out his side window to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
