dialogues.text: Giving chase, the way a wolf would run down a rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blackhawk banks and swerves in evasive action; the creature can't get a clean hit with its phosphorous. But the rate its closing, in a few seconds, it won't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn stares at Colleen, handling the many controls like virtuosc organist. She's pretty calm, given the situation

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Anything I can do?

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Nah. Quinn looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Trust me. We're being watched over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is now within spitting distance of the Blackhawk. Its maw opens, its throat starts RATTLING... WHAM! A spiked SONIC GRENADE CANNISTER SLAMS into the bea neck. It CLAMPS to the skin and emits a deafening WHINE. The Dragon reels back to see

dialogues.speaker: A HANGLIDING "ANGEL"
dialogues.text: sweeping by with amazing grace. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARCHANGEL
dialogues.text: {Into his helmet mic) Seraph, this is Archangel One...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHANGEL
dialogues.text: -..we got it from here. Quinn looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: THE HANGLIDING "ANGELS" ARE BATTLING THE DRAGON MID-AIR
dialogues.text: It's an awesome sight. Their long rifles look like ANGEL STAFFS. Against the behemoth, Gideon and his men seem as sparrows trying to bring down an eagle. The Dragon twists, trying to get a fix on the annoying gn It sees Archangel #1, lets out a phosphorous stream. Archangel #1 easily banks away... ...and Archangel #2 closes in. He raises his rifle, FIRES His sonic grenade SLAMS into the Dragon's face like a bur The Dragon begins to thrash in pain.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHANGEL
dialogues.text: (Into helmet mic) Gideon, it's all yours.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH ABOVE THEM
dialogues.text: Gideon glides almost listlessly. His glider sweeps up...a then PLUNGES DOWN -- like a hawk going in for the attack

dialogues.speaker: THE DRAGON
dialogues.text: neither hears nor sees him.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: holds out his rifle, takes aim.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: All right, snake... (Finger tightens on trigger) .-here's mud in your ear. He FIRES! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The sonic grenade SLAMS into the exposed stretched TYMPAN of the Dragon's ear. It GOES OFF IN A HIGH-PITCHED WHINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear it as the beast hears it: AN UNENDURABLE BLAST OF SOUND. The Dragon shakes its head to disengage the grenade. But metal is deeply embedded in its ear, and its legs are too short to get to it. There's no way to dislodge it in the So the beast does the only thing it can; it descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watch in awe as the monster falls.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: I call that a bloody miracle.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (Nods at Van Zan) I think he calls it "step one”...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan yells into his headset.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Jonah units, fall in! THE AML MINI-TANKS speed over the ground, their harpoon launchers lowering as they approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dragon COMES DOWN to earth, thrashing violently. It drags its head over the ground, scraping the sonic gre from its ear. But it's no sooner done that when...

dialogues.speaker: FIRE
dialogues.text: The First Mini-tank FIRES ITS HARPOON! The projectile kni through the air, connected to the tank by a WIRE ON A WIN SHHHK! It PIERCES the Dragon under its RIGHT WING. The Second Mini-tank FIRES its harpoon, which strikes int the Dragon on the opposite side, under the LEFT WING. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ww 59.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Dragon is now pinioned on both sides -- like Gulliver tied down by the Lilliputians. It struggles, trying to fr itself. And that's just when THE ABRAMS TANK rolls into view. The Dragon BLASTS it with fire. A flaming "fuck you".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMSEY, the tank gunner, takes aim.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Fuck you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Abrams BLASTS a TWO FOOT SHELL right back at the mons It STRIKES the Dragon right by its belly. The monster twi in a spasm...and two huge BOULDERS come up from its mouth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny Goodwin looks over at Creedy. He holds up two finge "step two".

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Missionaries, move in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is movement, as if the ground has become alive. It' Van Zan's FOOT SOLDIERS, camouflaged against the scorched earth. They run forward into battle, guns a-blazing!

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: sees this is the moment. He turns to the Firemen.

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE TOP, LADS
dialogues.text: Rifles in hand, Creedy and his men leap from their positi with an exuberant WAR CRY! Like a scene from a WWII battle, Englishmen join with Americans in a final, savage charge toward

dialogues.speaker: THE DRAGON
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: now unable to use its wings or fire. It can only LASH OUT with its cable-like tongue, trying to retrieve the boulde that will allow it to reignite its flame.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (To the Fireman)

dialogues.speaker: KEEP IT AWAY FROM THE ROCKS
dialogues.text: A HAIL OF GUNFIRE. The Firemen let loose with everything they've got, keeping the dragon away from the boulders. The Dragon's tongue whips out, SKEWERING A FIREMAN RIGHT THROUGH THE TORSO. Its head STRIKES FORWARD LIKE A SNAKE, GRABBING A FOOTSOL AND TEARING HIM TO PIECES IN ITS SWORD-LENGTH TEETH. But another Soldier unleashes a barrage of EXPLOSIVE-TIPP BULLETS AT THE DRAGON'S FACE, SEVERING ITS TONGUE. The creature is now utterly defenseless. It's payback tim

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: All units...stand by for communion. The footsoldiers begin to pull back; the firemen follow t Van Zan walks over, bearing The Pope on his back, backpac style. He walks with the measured steps of an executioner

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (To Creedy) "Step three"? Van Zan stops a ways from the Dragon. He glares at it lik general meeting a vanquished, unrepentant foe. The Dragon HISSES and SPITS. It's difficult to know who hates who mo

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: (To The Pope) Bless him. In a weird Janus moment, Van Zan turns his back on the Dragon, thus turning The Pope toward it. The Pope raises RPG, rests it on his and Van Zan's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: THE POPE
dialogues.text: In the name of the father.. (He takes aim.) And the son... (Puts finger on trigger) And the holy ghost... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Dragon opens its mouth to HISS in defiance.

dialogues.speaker: THE POPE
dialogues.text: Buh-bye. The Pope FIRES! The grenade rocket bursts from the RPG... ...into the creature's mouth... ...and the Dragon EXPLODES IN BLAST OF PHOSPHOROUS!

dialogues.speaker: ON CREEDY
dialogues.text: who now understands the meaning of step number...

dialogues.speaker: FOUR
dialogues.text: He grabs the firemen nearest him, dives for cover as THE BATTLEGROUND IS FLOODED WITH BURNING DEBRIS. Chaos for a moment. Then, slowly, the debris settles.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY AND THE FIREMEN
dialogues.text: look up. There's barely enough dragon left to bait a hook Van Zan lights his cigar from a burning piece of debris, strikes a somber pose of victory over the incinerated cor A CLICK-FLASH from a camera is heard-seen. FIND a Soldier taking Van Zan's pictures with an old polaroid.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Okay. Now a profile... Van Zan shifts his pose. CLICK-FLASH. As for the Firemen, there's only a stunned silence. Final Eddie Stax breaks it. He begins to clap his hands. The others join in. The applause grows into rousing CHEER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn can't believe his eyes. He LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, aS if out of nowhere, ANOTHER BLIP appears on scree  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn looks through the chin bubble...and reacts. He grab the COLLECTIVE CONTROL STICK by Colleen's left, pulls. it

dialogues.speaker: HEY...
dialogues.text: The Blackhawk SHOOTS UP VERTICALLY, just in time to avoid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECOND DRAGON, lashing at the copter's rails with its t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Radar Operator is heard over Van Zan's headset.

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR, (OS)
dialogues.text: Shepherd, we got another! Slipped right under the goddam radar... Van Zan immediately moves back into action.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: All units, BACK TO ONE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: banks away, the Second Dragon behind them. It's one-and-a half times the size of the last one; sleeker, deadlier.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN, (0.S., OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Be advised. This one's a Full Adult Soldier. Very smart, very pissed.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKHAWK COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Colleen calls over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Archangel, what's your position?

dialogues.speaker: SKY
dialogues.text: Gideon and his "angels" are only a hundred feet above gro

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: No good, Coll! We're too far down!

dialogues.speaker: BLACKHAWK COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Colleen swears, then speaks into the radio. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Releasing countermeasures... She presses a SWITCH on her Cyclic Control.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE BLACKHAWK
dialogues.text: a CARGO DOOR on the bottom opens up, releasing THIRTY SON GRENADES, each with A SMALL PARACHUTE. They fly into the like flowers scattered to the wind.

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND DRAGON
dialogues.text: passes through the parachutes. The whine of the sonic grenades deflect its focus off the helicopter, the way a submarine's countermeasure would deflect a torpedo But this ruse only works for a moment. After burning seve of the decoys, its back on the trail of the Blackhawk.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: observes from the ground. Worried.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: It's not going for it, Colleen.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKHAWK COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Colleen's brow is knit in concentration.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (OS, OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Continue evasives and get the hell out...

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: It's kinda late to turn the other cheek. Quinn looks out the window toward the dragon...then towar the back of the helicopter toward a WINCH AND CABLE.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: How strong is that cable? Colleen looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND
dialogues.text: looking throagh binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Wha. the...? The BLACKHAWK is turning IN THE DIRECTION OF THE DRAGON.  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn is tying the cable around his waist.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: This is crazy...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: So's everything else I've seen. (Smiles at her.) By the by, if it doesn't work...this was a grand first date. And with that, Quinn SLIDES OUT OF THE CHOPPER ON THE CAB

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn dangles twenty feet down the cable. His weight on t cable causes it to remain vertical like plumb line. The Blackhawk begins to accelerate toward

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND DRAGON
dialogues.text: which keeps coming. It's like a game of aerial chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: screams into his headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen doesn't answer, just keeps her focus on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: which begins its fire-rattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging on as the behemoth moves toward them.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: (Into his headset) Remember, go for the joint...  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: blasts out a PHOSPHOROUS ARC!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen throws the Cyclic to the left with all her might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BLACKHAWK TURNS SIDEWAYS, so that it's rotors are now degrees. It misses the phosphorous bolt... Quinn swings to the right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen barely manages to hold onto the controls as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn holds on for dear life while the cable CUTS THROUGH dragon's bone and into the membrane of the wing.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Oh, this was a bloody bad idea... Quinn is PULLED THROUGH THE MEMBRANE OF THE WING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRIES OUT IN RAGE! It begins to plummet, its torn wing streaming like a tattered banner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sees the second dragon falling. He nods, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: That's original. He runs with The Pope for its landing site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen stabilizes the Blackhawk. Still flying, still ali

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Quinn!! Are you okay?  6€.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging on, his entire body covered with dragon blood.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Spiffy, luv. I'm... LIGHTS AND ELECTRICITY in the chopper suddenly die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hurtles helplessly downward begins its own form of defens It executes a bizarre aerial manoeuver. It STRAIGHTENS it body out vertically like an arrow, then begins to SPIN, wrapping its head and body protectively its good wing. The result is a finely honed spear, plummeting to earth.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: knows exactly what it's doing.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: You little...

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND DRAGON
dialogues.text: STRIKES into the earth head first! The creature BURROWS I THE GROUND LIKE A WORM, disappearing in seconds.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? You wanna burrow on me?! (To headset) Set a sonic on that son-of~a-bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Radar Qerator turns to a SECOND SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Switching to ultra-sound. The screen somes on. It begins a SUBTERRANEAN SCAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen flips the circuits but it is no good. Power's gon

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: (Into headset) Ive lost power. We're gonna have to aiwworotate!  67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn looks down.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: (Into headset) Would that be anything like falling? The copter moves to a flat pitch, allowing some lift to t rotors. Stiil, it's VERY much like falling.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Right... He starts climbing as the copter descends hellishly fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's dead quiet. Van Zan whispers to The Pope.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Get ready. It could surface anywhere. The Pope nods, starts to reload the RPG. Van Zan looks up He sees the Blackhawk descending from the heavens. VAN ZAN (cont'd) (To headset) Colleen, you're coming down in the middle of my battlefield!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: struggling to climb back up before the copter crash-lands

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: (To headset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Radar Operator watches the ultra-sound. A BLIP appear

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Shepherd, we got a fix...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan is caught between listening to the headset and watching the Blackhawk's crash-landing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR, (0S)
dialogues.text: 39 degrees West...

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND SUDDENLY EXPLODES BEHIND HIM
dialogues.text: He and The Pope are thrown forward in A SPRAY OF BLACK EA Van Zan hits the ground on his front face first stunning

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on his back, attached to Van Zan's back by his harness. H RPG is just a few feet away. He reaches for it, but is restrained by the harness. Just then hears a RATTLING right behind him. He turns to

dialogues.speaker: THE POPE
dialogues.text: Oh, cr... SMASH! The Dragon SINKS ITS RAZOR SHARP TEETH into his to The Pope SCREAMS as the creature lifts both him and Van Z still attached to the boy by the harness -- into the air. Van Zan comes to as the creature shakes its head violentl The Dragon's teeth have fortunately not penetrated him. He pulls a BUCKLE on the harness, releasing him. He is thrown to the side...tucks and rolls as he hits the groun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! The Blackhawk SLAMS into the earth nearby. Its landing skits CRUMPLE with the impact. Quinn is thrown off, landing right next to the RPG. Worki on pure figtter's instinct, he grabs it, whirls around... ...and finds himself in a wild Mexican standoff. He's got the RPG aimed at the dragon, who still has The P in its maw. The boy's alive. Blood trickles from his lips Van Zan rises from the ground, sees the situation.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Shoot it! Quinn puts his finger on the trigger...and hesitates. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The dragon starts backing toward its burrow.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for? SHOOT!!

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: It's got your man!! Van Zan's eye flits from the Dragon to The Pope. The boy looks at him, coughing blood but still defiant. He nods at Van Zan. And we go into

dialogues.speaker: SLOW MOTION
dialogues.text: Van Zan suddenly makes a run at the dragon. From his ches he pulls a GRENADE. Quinn yells, tries to stop him. Van Zan gets near the beast, DIVES aside, tosses the gren

dialogues.speaker: THE POPE
dialogues.text: who catches it in his free hand, rips the pin with his te

dialogues.speaker: THE POPE
dialogues.text: Bite me. The Pope SLAMS GRENADE AGAINST HIMSELF IN THE DRAGON'S MO We don't see the explosion that engulfs both the Dragon a the boy; only Quinn's horrified reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banners high and triumphant, Van Zan's militia and the firemen make their way from the killing fields, the drago carcasses Still smouldering behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn drives in tense silence. Creedy sits shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: There's nothin' you coulda done. (No response. ) The lad was dead meat, you know that. (No response) For Chrissakes, Quinn, it was merciful... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Tryin' to save him woulda been merciful. Creedy is silent.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Doesn't it bother you, what he did?

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Honestly? Those worms bothered me more. And he killed ‘em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goosh's truck pumps ROCK 'N' ROLL TUNES into a courtyard filled with people. A party's in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny pulls pints from old beer kegs, serves them to the firemen and Van Zan's militia. Creedy grabs some glasses, carries them to Van Zan, who sits at the "table of honor" Gideon stands atop the council table, reciting the day's exploits like a medieval bard. Eddie accompanies him on a bodahrun (irish drum).

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: .+..and you who saw this today: remember it. Tell it to your children. Tell dem about de man who shook hands wid Destiny. (Points at Van Zan.) De St. George of Cincinnati. (Cheers from the crowd) De Beowulf of da Bronx! (Louder cheers.)

dialogues.speaker: DE VAN ZAN MAN
dialogues.text: The crowd erupts with the HUGEST CHEERS yet. Van Zan smil broadly, not feigning the faintest attempt at modesty. Colleen takes a seat next to Quinn, who is unusually quie She nudges him.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: You okay? Quinn half-smiles, looks back warily at Van Zan, Cries of SPEECH! SPEECH! from the crowd. Van Zan rises modestly, puts up his arms for quiet. The crowd hushes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: I've been to many places. Liberated many towns. But I want you to know, it is a special honor to be here tonight... From one of his soldiers, he takes a folded CLOTH.

dialogues.speaker: VAN Z2AN
dialogues.text: ..-and it is a personal privilege to Claim your island...as the 51st state of the United States of America! He unfolds the cloth: it's a U.S. FLAG. The Englishmen react to the joke with good~natured...

dialogues.speaker: ENGLISHMEN
dialogues.text: Boo! Bollocks! Yer arse! The Americans strike up a chorus of...

dialogues.speaker: VAN Z2AN'S MEN
dialogues.text: “My country 'tis of thee, sweet land of liberty, of thee I sing..." Not to be outdone, Quinn and his men start a chorus of

dialogues.speaker: QUINN/ENGLISHMEN
dialogues.text: "God save our sovr'gn Queen, God save our gracious Queen, God save our queen..." Both songs have the same tune.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN'S MEN
dialogues.text: "Land of the pilgrims' pride Land where our fathers died..." "Prom e-e-every mountainside..." And soon, whether the lyrics match or not, all are singin the same song.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: "Let freedom ring!" The moment is unexpectantly moving for all present. As th song ends, the group erupts in CHEERS and APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Tell you what. Creedy'1ll give you Cumbria if you stay through winter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: ( Fookin' A. We got three worms in Workington need dustin'.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Those four in leeds...

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Two in Canterbury...

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: London. The mention of that name throws them all off a beat.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: Main stop on the tour, ladies. Why you think we're here? An uncomfortable silence has fallen among the English.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You...don't wanna go to London, mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Ashley's town.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: Well, next week it'll be mine. Everyone is silent. You can hear a pin drop.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: Jesus wept,. doesn't it bother you people? The bitch that started this whole mess sleeps 200 miles away.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Sure, but...you gotta understand...

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Ashley's different.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Well, we can tell you what we've heard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: "Heard"? You tellin' me none of you have even seen this thing? Nobody answers. But slowly, they all turn to Quinn. Van Zan moves his chair over to him.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Chief. Enlighten us. What's it like, this..."Ashley"? Quinn smiles grimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mosquito skims over the hilly landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn flies. Van Zan sits in the gunner's seat, staring a FADED POSTCARD seen earlier on Quinn's wall: the PHOTO OF CASTLE with inscription: PEMBREY CASTLE.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Man who trained me was Fire Chief here. Pretty much how it looked back then.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: So? Quinn just gestures to the window. Van 2an looks out as t plane rises above a ridge. Veteran though he is, even Van Zan isn’t prepared for the sight that now spills across the horizon...

dialogues.speaker: THE RUINS OF PEMBREY CASTLE
dialogues.text: It's not just been destroyed; it's been erased. As if God torn it apart stone by stone, then melted it to the groun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dance floor of death. Weapons lie melted on rock next t HIROSHIMA SILHOUETTES of people incinerated where they fought. Charred clothes, cracked utensils, melted toys li strewn over the site like surreal decorations.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (0S)
dialogues.text: Fall a '16 they were strong, bold, proud. When their Fire Chief called for a raid on London, everyone cheered. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FIND Quinn and Van Zan walking through the wreckage. QUINN (cont'd) He knew the risks, a course. Twelve castles'd already gone up against Ashley. Men went to London. Never come back. But Ashley always did... Quinn kneels, picks at something on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: She'd follow their trails home. Then burn every man, woman an’ child to the ground. We see what Quinn has been picking at: CHILDREN'S CRAYONS meited over the ground. The color is almost pretty agains the scorched background.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: But my old Chief, he was gonna be different. He comes to my castle, tells me how he's gonna do the old girl. Asks for my help.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: You give it to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a large CROSS, crudely fashioned with old rusted metal pipes. It's been set in the ground as a gravemarker

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Dug these, didn't I? REVEAL IT IS ONE IN A VAST FIELD OF GRAVEMARKERS. Hundred of similar crosses stretching to the horizon. Wind blows through the pipe-crucifixes, making hollow, almost musica sounds. Like ghosts, whispering to each other.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: If I'd had sense, I'da beaten the shite out of him 'fore he left my gate...

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2FN
dialogues.text: So what's your point?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Ashley's not just some "Snake", Van Zan. She's a flyin' Apocalypse. You can't go stirrin' her up. Van Zan stares at him, his eyes frighteningly glacial. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: You have no idea what I can do. He walks past Quinn into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn catches up with him.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Look, I'm the only one alive who's seen the bitch! Trust me. She's older, smarter an' meaner than anything you...

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: (Turning on him) What she is is their weakness.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: What? VAN 2AN (cont'd) All the intel says she's killed every other dragon female. She's the only egg- layer their species has left. We take her out, no more babies. No more babies, no more dragons. No more war.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Bollocks. You've not even seen her eggs.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Have you? (No response.) No. Cause you didn't have the guts to stand with your pal. Beat. Quinn comes close to him, deadly calm.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: You callin' me coward, mate?

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: You're not a coward. You're weak. Tell me, Chief: how many men would you sacrifice to kill a dragon? A hundred? (No response. ) Fifty?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: One? (Shakes his head) You don't stand and fight. You rescue and run.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: And you'd rather kill one a them than Save one a yours.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Yes I would! They're the master fuckin' race, Fireman. They've wiped out every dominant species on this planet and we're next. The only way we're going to live is if we're bloody and ruthless as them!

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I'd rather die before I became like them.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: That's why you'll lose. Beat. Van Zan turns, walks into the field. Wind picks up, blows through the pipe-gravemarkers. Hollow sounds rise f them, like a hushed chorus of the dead.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...he won't listen to me, Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen makes repairs on the Blackhawk. Quinn helps her.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Well talk to your crew, then. Tell ‘em it's suicide...

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: The gears don't turn that way.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Well then how do they bloody turn? Colleen looks at the ramparts a long moment. She sighs.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Ever heard of the Samurai? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Japanese scrappers. Why?

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: When a person became a Samurai, he was considered dead. That's what...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: +--what gave him the courage to fight.So?

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: We've all lost and died, Quinn. Pope snuffed it when he lost his legs. Van Zan when he lost his brother...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Yeah, and I lost me mum. You don't see me walkin' round like a ghoulie.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Well, maybe you need to lose more.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Why? What did you lose?

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Enough.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Enough you want to die?

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Enough I can't have what I want.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Do you want to stay with him? She is silent.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I'm just askin'. Cause if you don't... there's room here. Beat. He comes closer to her. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: I've seen hundreds of these places, Quinn. It's no way to live...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: It is if you're building something. Colleen looks at him. They're quite close. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: It's not that simple.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Course it is. You just tell him goodbye. Pack your gear...

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Change out of my flight suit?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Change out of your flight suit, an'... She starts to unzip her flightsuit.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't quite mean now... Quinn stops. She's unzipped the suit so that just the top her chest is exposed. It is a mass of SCAR TISSUE. Colleen's face has remained impassive.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Snakes flamed my house when I was 8. My nightdress caught fire. Van Zan managed to put it out before it got to my face. (Smiles dryly.) Thank God for small favors, huh? Silence. Colleen zips up the suit, turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Colleen? (Comes over to her.) You're alive enough for me. She doesn't believe that for a second. Quinn turns her he to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: I'm not...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: You are. (Takes her hand.) You're alive. Their fingers begin to intertwine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is overcast, the first hints of an incoming storm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The firemen are assembled. Quinn looks at them in disbeli

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Well...either I'm goin' deaf, or you're goin' mental. Which is it? Uncomfortable beat as Quinn stares into their faces.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: It's only a couple days...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Ak "couple days"? You just gonna pop down to London? See the sights, kill The Ashley, come back for tea?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: We're askin' for your help, Quinn. Not your permission. Quinn can't believe his ears.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It's like he said, Chief. In London, there's buildings standin'. There's medicine an' food...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: In London there's Ashley, and that's it! Christ Jesus, people, don't you remember what it did to Pembry?!

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: We know it's risky. But we got a chance now. With Van Zan's help...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: He hasn't seen the bloody thing. I have.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Ome. An' that 20 years ago. Quinn shoots Eddie a withering look.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I mean...you were a kid. Everything seems ( bigrer then. Your room, your house... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: She's bigger than my house, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I'm just sayin'...

dialogues.speaker: _ QUINN
dialogues.text: She's bigger than BIG-FUCKIN'-BEN! Quinn OVERTURNS a table filled with equipment; it falls t the floor with a CRASH! Everyone stares at him, wide-eyed

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: We got a fire drill 3:00 on Ban's Field. Anyone doesn't show up can consider himself off my brigade. Permanently. Quinn leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn sits on the ground by his horse. He stares down at pocket watch. It reads 3:00.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF TIME LAPSES
dialogues.text: Quinn watching and waiting. The watch now reads 4:15. Non of his firemen have shown up. He hears something, looks up to see Colleen, walking toward him over the blackened hill. She comes near him. An uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Denton called a drill same time as yours. Quinn glances around at the obvious lack of people.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Why aren't you with him? She sits opposite him but does not meet his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: I needed to ask you something.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know. As you can see, I'm a rather busy individual... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: You...you really think we can't win? Beat. Quinn shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: If he goes up against Ashley, he'll be killing every man, woman and child in my community. He's said this with such even-handed conviction that it's chilling. Colleen is silent, now nervous.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: All right. I'll talk to him...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it's beyond that, luv. He goes over to his horse.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: (Mounts his horse) What I shoulda done before.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Quinn, c'mon... (Grabs the horses rein) You're smarter than this. It doesn't have to be about taking sides! He gives her a sad smile, then SPURS his horse forward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan's soldiers drill with Quinn's firemen. Van Zan himself sits atop his tank, shouting orders into a MEGAPH

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: ...back to one. Right wing, left wheel... The firemen move to reposition themselves. Suddenly, Cree stops. As does Eddie and Danny Goodwin and soon all the rest. Van Zan turns to see they are staring at Quinn, taking a stand near the tank. He holds his pulaski his hands like some sort of medieval weapon. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: I don't got time for your alpha-dog shit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With a huge swing, Quinn SLAMS the pulaski head first int the ground. It's like throwing down a gauntlet.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Make some. The confused firemen look at their chief, then Van Zan.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: You got a beef with me, come up and settle it like an adult.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Why don't you come down and settle it like a man? Van Zan just rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Or do you just do crippled kids? At that, Van Zan's face goes terribly and utterly dark. I dead silence, he descends from the Abrams, walks to Quinn Slow, imminent. A casual avalanche of rage. Quinn holds his ground up to the moment Van Zan's upon hi SLAM! It's not clear who throws the first blow, and it doesn't really matter. Within moments, the two are lettin into each other with all the fury they can muster. Creedy tries to intervene, but Gideon holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: GIDEON
dialogues.text: He picked it... The fight quickly degenerates into a brutal mano e mano street brawl. Neither English or Americans dare interfere Easily the better fighter, Van Zan slams Quinn with a ser of blows that sends him to the ground. But Quinn won't quit. He rises, charges the man, knocks h back. Van Zan pulls a reversal, hurls Quinn into the tank Quinn slumps painfully, but catches himself before fallin He shakily regains his footing, faces off with Van Zan ag

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Aren't we just "Mr. Come-and-Get-It"? Quinn charges and the two come together in a deathlock. A immovable object meeting an irresistible force, Van Zan (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: punches him repeatedly, trying to dislodge him. But Quinn won't let go, even as his insides are hammered into jello Colleen comes running through the gates, sees the brawl.

dialogues.speaker: STOP IT
dialogues.text: Her actions open a floodgate. Men from both sides interve to separate them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn wakes painfully in his cot. Face bruised ribs banda He looks up to see Creedy sitting beside him. The Cumbria leans over, puts a cup to Quinn's lips.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: (Barely a whisper) What's this?

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Water. Quinn pushes it away. They stare at each other. Creedy's face is a mix of emotion.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Quinn Abercromby, resident earth mother. Saves everyone, makes everything okay. Well, it's not okay, Quinn. Look at you! Quinn just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: Don't look at me like tha'. You think I wanted this?

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Don't know...what you want...

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: What I want? You wanna know what I fookin' want? (Beat) I want a proper oven! The admission's comical except for the catch in his voice

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: That's right. And matchin' steak knives. And green groceries. I wanna feed people (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CREEDY (cont'd) till they're sick in the face. (Sits) I want children. I wanna know they'll outlive me. (Looks at Quinn, eyes wet.) I don't want to be afraid anymore. Silence. Quinn takes Creedy's hand.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: You want...too much... Quinn closes his eyes, slips back into unconsciousness. Creedy turns round, sees Van Zan standing in the doorway. He's pretty beat up, but still burning with belief.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Doesn't mean you can't get it. OFF Creedy's conflicted face we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To a CHEERING CROWD, a combined convoy of firemen and mil heads out the gate. Firetrucks have been outfitted for wa The Blackhawk takes off from the center of courtyard. We Colleen in the pilot's seat. A SHEET is pulled off a Mowag MISSILE CARRIER. Revealed i huge MISSILE. Across its side: 70 ASHLEY, WITH LOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy drives over shattered asphalt toward its desti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melted 20th century vehicles line the road. A torn street sign, hanging from an underpass like the Sw of Damocles. It reads: LONDON. 100 MILES The convoy has stopped. All stare in awe at something o.s

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: (A whisper, to Gideon) You ever seen anythin’ like tha'? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gideon shakes his head. For the first time he seems unsur A_MOUNTAIN OF ASH RISES BEFORE THEM. A hundred feet, pointing up to the air like an accusing finger. : Danny Goodwin nervously inspects it base. It's filled wit BURNT HUMAN BONES AND SKULLS. He looks back at Van Zan, who rides atop the Abrams.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It's...all human. All eyes turn to Van Zan. The man remains impassive. He taps the top of the Abrams, signalling it to move on. tank and convoy lurch forward, not so enthusiastically. TILT UP to reveal MANY SUCH MOUNTAINS rising in the dista They look like giant pylons on a highway to Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn's just awoken. He painfully pulls himself off the b Jared and Beth enter with trays of food. They stop short.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Mr. Quinn, you can't get up. You're broken!

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Where is everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The combined fireman/militia forces are spread over the h Van Zan turns to Goosh, sitting in the sound truck.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Start it up. Goosh looks down nervously at the sight miles below them.

dialogues.speaker: THE CITY OF LONDON
dialogues.text: a blasted skyline of a city cauterized by flame. A sight unnerving it gives everybody pause. Goosh's hand goes to press the audio button, then stops. He's not exactly wild about opening this Pandora's box. Van Zan pushes him aside, presses the button himself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A CD comes into play. From the speakers bursts forth an A from Handel's MESSIAH.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: And he Shall purify... The voice swells skyward, toward a darkening horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn, hastily clothed, makes his way to the Mosquito.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: ...but you said it was wrong to go.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: It is. But if he won't listen to sense, maybe he'll talk strategy. He can't beat Ashley like he did the others.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: And you can? Quinn doesn't answer. He climbs into the Mosquito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn pilots the Mosquito from a bunker outside the castl walls. Lights blazing, the plane rises into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creedy sits nervously in position. He looks over at Danny the other Firemen. Everyone's on edge. A RUMBLE OF THUNDER is heard from a far away bank of clou

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (Making the best of it) Maybe we'll get rained out. The Blackhawk zooms over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gideon and the other Archangels sit fidgeting anxiously w their harnesses. Colleen speaks into the headset.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Good Shepherd, we're getting low on fuel. Suggest we call it a day.  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan impatiently scans the sky with his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Negative.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Denton, it's been three hours. We're pissing in the wind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTENING FLASHES put a host of skeletal structures into spectral bas relief: the wreckages of the HOUSES OF PARLIAMENT; the torn spires of WESTMINSTER ABBEY. A FINAL FLASH reveals the gothic gargantua of BIG BEN. But something's odd about the famed clocktower. The shape just slightly off-kilter. A moment later, we see why...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blackhawk comes to a landing. Van Zan moves towards i angrily as Colleen gets out.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Goddammit, I told you to stay in the air... Suddenly, the music STOPS. Van Zan turns toward

dialogues.speaker: THE SOUND VAN
dialogues.text: where a hand comes away from the button. It's Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: It's too late for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGE WINGS begin to unfurl from Big Ben's sides. A GIGANT TORSO unwinds from its center tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn turns to the collection of firemen and soldiers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me! We got to get off the open ground and pull back to the marsh...

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: We're not pulling back anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: You bleeding moron! She knew you were here hours ago. She was waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GIGANTIC SHADOW falls over one of the many ash mountain An artificial WIND starts to pick. The ash begins scatter

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: ...I am not gonna stand here and debate lizard intelligence with...

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Radar Operator stares at his screen.

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: We...got something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Van Zan can react...

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Good Christ. We see what he's looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Row after row of the ash mountains are COMING APART in th artificial wind. Its like a TIDAL WAVE OF GRAy, sweeping the south of the city toward the north. Specifically towa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cloud engulfs them like a demon's hurricane. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The effect is at once blinding and disorienting. Smoke chokes the air. HOT CINDERS light up the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burning cinders fly through the open windows, falling on Goosh. His long hair and beard CATCH FIRE. Goosh panics, trying to put it out. In the process, his h accidently slams against the control board. A CD CLICKS o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and from the speakers bursts the most famous movement Handel's MESSIAH: the "Hallelujah Chorus”. CHOIR VOICES OVER P.A. Hallelujah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chaos of the cinder cloud is now compounded by the mu Van Zan yells into his headset, but his voice is drowned. Quinn turns to his men.

dialogues.speaker: VISORS ON
dialogues.text: The firemen grab for their helmets and protective visors. Goosh falls from the sound truck SCREAMING bloody murder. His hair and beard are afire, like a bizarre halo. Quinn runs to him. He pulls off his own jacket, starts smothering the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Radar Operator hears a BEEP from

dialogues.speaker: THE RADAR SCREEN
dialogues.text: A GIANT BLIP has appeared right in the center of the scre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black ash/cinder cloud begins to disperse and PART, a to signal the entrance of some divine being. CHOIR VOICES OVER P.A. For the Lord God omnipotent reigneth! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Colleen looks up into the sky. Her jaw drops. Quinn stares up from Goosh's body. All the Firemen and Militia are frozen where they stand. Even Van Zan is silenced as his greatest adversary rises behind the ridge of the hill. A leviathan's head more terrifying than any biblical mons A serpentine body longer than a freight train. And a 200-foot wing span that blots out the very sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE ASHLEY
dialogues.text: No mere animal; she is a force of nature. Like a fallen angel emanating arrogance and power, she rises to her ful height and greatness before the pathetic human beings. Now, accompanied by one of the most beautiful pieces of m ever written, the creature begins a sinfonia of destructi CHOIR VOICES OVER P.A. The kingdom of this world...

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: yells orders into his headset. CHOIR VOICES OVER P.A. -..is become...

dialogues.speaker: THE FIREMER AND MILITIA
dialogues.text: scatter to take up positions. CHOIR VOICES OVER P.A. The kingdom of Our Lord!

dialogues.speaker: THE ASHLEY'S FACE
dialogues.text: Ears FLATTEN like a cat in attack mode. She opens her maw 1

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: covers Goosh with his bedy as the blast STRIKES the groun the sound truck. The truck is BLASTED ten feet into the aixr...the FLIPS DOWN right on top of them.

dialogues.speaker: CREEDY
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: manages to throw himself over a dirt embankment. But

dialogues.speaker: DANNY GOODWIN
dialogues.text: and most of the firemen are ‘not so lucky. Man and machin are INCINERATED as totally as if it were an atomic blast.

dialogues.speaker: THE AML MINITANKS
dialogues.text: FIRE their harpoons at the passing behemoth. CHOIR VOICES OVER P.A. And He shall reign forever and ever! The harpoons STRIKE home under the wings of

dialogues.speaker: THE ASHLEY
dialogues.text: who doesn't even slow down. CHOIR VOICES OVER P.A. And He shall reign forever and ever! The Ashley DRAGS THE VEHICLES OFF THE EDGE OF THE HILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen takes off with Eddie, Andy, Gideon and the "angel readying themselves in their harnesses. CHOIR VOICES OVER P.A. King of Kings!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter rises into the sky. Gracefully, almost casually, The Ashley's wing lightly touches the whirring rotor blades. CHOIR VOICES OVER P.A. And Lord of Lords! THWANG! The rotors COME APART!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen and her crew tumble within as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Caught at night in the cloudbank, he floating completely blind...and utterly defenseless. For a long moment, just the RUSH OF THE WIND. And then, something else...a WHOOSH of what might be wing He opens his eyes. He still can't see anything. WHOOSH. Was that a shape through the clouds? Gideon nervously pulls his last weapon...a .45 revolver. (CONTINUED)

Gideon floats down through the cloudbreak into the clear He can see again. For a moment, he seems relieved. But then, he looks down... .»..and sees THE ASHLEY'S MOUTH COMING RIGHT UP AT HIM! Gideon SCREAMS! And a PHOSPHOROUS BLAST TURNS HIS CHUTE INTO A BLOOM OF F

dialogues.text: Man-sized, horribly wrinkled. AN EMBRYONIC DRAGON. Clearly premature, not fully formed. Stunted wings, mouth pathetically opening and closing like a drowning fish. Colleen sheathes her knife. FLIP! The Embryonic Dragon is suddenly ON ITS FEET. Thoug only a partially formed preemie, it's lethal from birth. The thing coils back, hissing in attack mode. Colleen draws her side-arm, FIRES, HITTING THE DRAGON DEA ON. It doesn't even phase the little bastard. The creature spreads its stunted wings, ready to spring. Colleen fires a final time. The bullet misses the dragon. ...and sparks nearby, right on the orange fluid. WHOOSH! The Embryonic Dragon and the area around it EXPLO IN A BLAST OF FLAME. Colleen stands, frozen. What the hell is this? An idea forms. She turns to another egg nearby. From her pocket, she pulls out an old Z2IPPO LIGHTER. She flicks on the flame, tosses it at the orange sphere. BOOM! The flame IGNITES the sphere, blasting it like a bo

dialogues.text: I was gonna say, "I know how you feel".

dialogues.text: Ever make it to Chicago, Quinn? Quinn stares at him, not following the connection. Quinn is h

dialogues.text: Shitty winters. Good pizza. (Beat. ) Night the snakes hit us, city went up like a Roman candle. Burned my folks in the first strike. Only way clear was the lake. It was Dunkirk, man. Every asshole with a boat was out there. Including me. (Beat. ) My kid brother and I, we were halfway across when the snakes flamed us. I remember thinkin', "got to get him into the water. Water's cold." And it was... until they started torchin' it. Figure it reached 150 degrees in minute. People were screamin'. Boilin'. Guess it was the snakes idea of a lobster bake. eld, despite himself.

dialogues.text: What the hell did you do?

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Dove. Held my brother in my arms and kicked for depth. Thought if we could stay under till the fire passed us... (Beat.) I was 15. Pretty good free diver. Kyle -- he was 9. No lung capacity. He gave me this scar when he started to struggle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: You...kept him down?

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: He'd've boiled alive up there. All I could do was...hold him. Kept telling myself: ‘this isn’t a person I'm killing. It's a fish. It's an animal. It's not...' His voice catches. Silence. He smiles grimly at Quinn. : VAN ZAN (cont'd) So you see, Mr. Buddy, we do have one thing in common. (Crushes out the cigarette.) Neither of us wants to be me. Quinn looks at him. Van Zan offers him the flask once aga After a long moment, Quinn takes it.

dialogues.text: Colleen finishes placing the charge. It's then she hears it: a DISTANT RUMBLING sound, like a subway train approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan hears it, too. ECHOING through the cavernous tunn No way to tell which direction it's coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn's sweating profusely, trying to ignore the sound an vibrations that resound in this open chamber. Hands shaki he places the last of his charges near the eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND picks up through the plaza, as if a train were comin Colleen presses her back against as the sound becomes DEAFENING. Suddenly, Van Zan's voice echoes in her headse

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Which way's it heading? East or West? Slowly, trembling, she peeks round the corner at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MIND THE GAP sign swings violently as

dialogues.speaker: THE ASHLEY
dialogues.text: speeds past, filling the length of the tunnel. She's so l that only her scaly midsection is visible as she rockets through like a biological subway train.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: darts back against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen's voice echoes in his headset.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN, (0.5.)
dialogues.text: She's heading right toward you! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Van Zan fixes the last of the charges, takes out the trig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn tries to fix his last. charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan takes a stand, ready to meet the creature head on He raises the trigger, thumb on the button... WIND washes down the tunnel... The RUMBLING BECOMES DEAFENING...and then... Silence. Sudden, utter, absolute. Van Zan stares suspiciously at the darkness before him.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: (Into headset) Colleen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MIND THE GAP sign stops swinging. Colleen stares down the platform.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: (Into headset) She's gone. I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: VAN 2AN
dialogues.text: (Into headset) Quinn. What's your status? Quinn's voice is unusually tense.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Y'know, it's funny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn stands stock still at the right end of the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: ...-but I've been better. a shadow slowly falls over him as

dialogues.speaker: THE ASHLEY RISES BEFORE HIM
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUEC
dialogues.text: She's entered the cave and moved to the left, wings sprea to each side, shielding the eggs around her. The scars of her massive injuries leak pus; she hisses with the venom wounded animal cornering its hunter. And yet, she does not attack. It's then Quinn notices: the beast's one remaining eye is fixed on the explosive in his hand. Ashley starts to move forward. Quinn raises the explosive up. Ashley stops, as if in reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn's whispers voice over Van Zan's headset

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Get out and blow the charges. Now! Van Zan stares at the trigger. He looks up uncertainly, t begins to move down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen begins to run east down her tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn's engaged in a staring contest with the serpent. Ashley makes her fire rattle.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Bou gonna use that fire around the kids? Ashley snaris. The rattle fades in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: VAN Z2AN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Over headset) Qxinn, listen to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan has reached the "T" intersection. He is staring a something tohis right o.-s.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: I sanna try something.  114.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Walk back toward the tunnel. Quinn glances at the opening to the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan moves down the intersecting tunnel] to his right.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Over headset) Van Zan, I told you...

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn slowly edges toward the opening, keeping the explos raised, keeping his eyes locked with Ashley. Ashley watches with her working right eye, looking for a chance to strike without activating Quinn's explosive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Van Zan's foot as he steps on a piece of machine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn walks backwards into the tunnel as Ashley slides forward, keeping pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan's hand brushes dust from a CONTROL PANEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn comes to the intersection of the t-junction. Ashley's tongue snakes out of her mouth toward him, just waiting to get a taste.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Any time you're ready. Really. Quinn passes the t-junction of the intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ashley comes into view. She can't see what lies in the tunnel to the left of her because of her blinded eye.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN, (OS)
dialogues.text: That'll do. Van Zan's hand comes down on a gearshift. And the tunnel is filled with the ROAR of

dialogues.speaker: THE TUNNEL BORING MACHINE
dialogues.text: Barrelling down the tunnel right at Ashley's blind side. Zan in the driver's seat, like a knight on his mount. Ashley realizes the trap. She tries to pull back... Van Zan floors it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running to the eastern tunnels, Colleen hears Ashley's scream, amplified a hundred-fold. She rounds a corner to

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Struggling against the TBM. Her tongue LASHES OUT, knocki Quinn backward.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: keeps his foot on the TBM's accelerator, keeping her pinn

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: runs to Quinn, helps him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: I've got her here! Get out!!

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Van Zan!

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: This is my deal, Goddammit! Quinn and Colleen look at him. It's as if Van Zan is pour all his fury into this final attack. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Go!!! There's no time to argue. Quinn and Colleen take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two race for the construction hole. Ashley's amplified shrieks mix with the metallic grind of TBM. It sounds like a mythical battle between two subterranean giants. “INT. UNCOMPLETED TUBE TUNNEL (VAN ZAN) The dragon THRASHES. The TBM starts to become DISLODGED. Van Zan keeps up the pressure on the accelerator. But SMO is beginning to pour from the TBM's engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn and Colleen make it to the bottom of the hole. They Start to climb like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan puts all his effort into the TBM's forward motion Machine smoke fills the air. It's fighting the inevitable. With a horrible grind, the TBM's motor LOCKS... ...and Ashley tosses her head to the side.

dialogues.speaker: THE TBM
dialogues.text: is knocked backward, slamming against the wall with such force that the cab compartment is CRUSHED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crash echoes up to the ears of Quinn and Colleen, in middle of their ascent.

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: They double time it toward the surface.  117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Zan lies crushed in the wreckage of the cak. He looks to see Ashley's face right over him. Ashley's eye falls upon Van Zan's hand. It has reached th trigger mechanism. Van Zan smiles a bloody smile.

dialogues.speaker: VAN ZAN
dialogues.text: Kiss my human ass... Ashley rears back. Van Zan presses the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explosives DETONATE all along the tunnels...causing A CHAIN REACTION of even greater explosions from the eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn and Colleen have just made it to the surface when t earth underneath shakes from the underground explosions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The egg-filled chamber IGNITES. A GIGANTIC BLAST SLAMS through into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the concussion is so great it BLASTS the dragon down the tunnel like a missile through a silo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge rents in the ground BREAK OPEN, followed by GEYSERS FLAME. It's as if hell has come to trade places with eart Colleen's THROWN BACK by one explosion, falling onto twis metal. One shard pierces through her leg. She cries out.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Colleen! Quinn gets to her, picks her up in a fireman's carry.  118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn races with Colleen down the street. Its like runnin through a war zone. Earth shaking...eggs exploding in fireballs... °

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearing the bank, Quinn sees their chance at escape.

dialogues.speaker: THE MOSQUITO
dialogues.text: parked in the dry river. Quinn begins to make for it when suddenly behind them

dialogues.speaker: LEY 1D 5
dialogues.text: Her whcle body is AFLAME. A fiery angel, she blasts into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climbing hundreds of feet in seconds...higher...higher... And then begins to DROP, like a flaming comet down to ear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn and Colleen look up.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Smart bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON ASHLEY diving down. She is using the velocity of hex descent to PUT THE FIRE ON HER BODY OUT. At fifty feet, the fire's extinguished. She arcs up... ...and sails over Quinn and Colleen. The force of her pas is like a jet; it knocks both the humans down on the grou Ashley doesn't even bother with them now, but heads STRAI INTO THE INFERNO OF LONDON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley beats her wings furiously, driving the fire away f an area where some of her eggs lie undamaged. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She gathers her eggs to her belly. A FLAP OF SKIN folds o revealing a MARSUPIAL-LIKE POUCH. Into this she pulls her progeny.

dialogues.speaker: ON QUINN AND COLLEEN
dialogues.text: looking on in horror.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, she's saving her kids! Quinn makes a snap decision. He immediately heads for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Colleen over his shoulder, Quinn quickly climbs down bank into the glassy surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her stomach now BLOATED TO CAPACITY WITH EGGS, Ashley ope her mouth, catches a dozen or so more under her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn gently lays Colleen down by the glassy bottom.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Winds blowing north. Fire won't touch you here. Quinn turns toward the Mosquito.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Where are you going?! Quinn doesn't answer, just books toward the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now loaded to capacity with her eggs, Ashley begins to ta to the air. She's like an overloaded B-52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn taxis the Mosquito down the glassy bed, into the ai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn starts to break over the burning city, framing Ashley, sailing the wind eastward... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And Quinn's Mosquito, right on her tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn's pushing the damaged plane to its limit to catch u It starts to SHAKE, barely held together by gum and strin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley swoops over the Thames River Barrier to the wet pa of the river.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Come on, luv... He lines up the sights on his forward guns.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Show me your belly. He FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machine gun fire RAKES over Ashley's back. Barely an annoyance, but she seems to know what Quinn is trying to In reaction, she pitches down toward the river.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley's SKIMMING THE SURFACE OF THE RIVER. Barely 10 fee above it, the tips of her great wings touch the water on every downbeat, forcing a wake to form. The Mosquito follows behind, skimming the surface as well

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn maneuvers for a way to get to her egg-filled gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mosquito swerves left, trying to get under Ashley's w (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FLICK! The dragon's tail SNAPS out, nearly striking the Mosquito's wing. Quinn swerves just in time. FLICK! FLICK! The dragon's tail is like a giant fly Swatter, trying to bat the plane out of the sky. But each slash of the tail leaves her underside exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Quinn takes advantage, firing his guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Ashley's belly. The bullets tear awfully close t the eggsack. Ashley counters with a move of her own. She opens her mou begins to release some of the eggs there. The eggs fall right in the path of the Mosquito which is Still firing. Its tracer bullet rip into the eggs. BOOM! The eggs EXPLODE near the plane like depth charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolts rock the plane. Quinn's barely able to stabilize he He knows the aircraft can't take much more of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley speeds down the estuary, headed toward the open se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn sees accelerates the plane in a final burst of spee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still skimming the water, Ashley passes over the coast an makes the freedom of the open ocean. However as she's flies from land to sea The Mosquito accelerates, FLYING RIGHT OVER HER BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn looks down. It's like passing over an island of rep skin, her wingspan nearly the size of a football field.  122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mosquito flies over Ashley's head to take a position RIGHT IN FRONT OF HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley sees the challenger in front of her. She decides t end this once and for all. She opens her mouth, releasing the last of the eggs kept there. Then, takes in a HUGE BREATH... And BLAM! LETS LOOSE HER LARGEST BLAST OF PHOSPHOROUS EVE The Mosquito dodges. But the blast TEARS into the ocean f a quarter of a mile, sending up a WALL OF SUPERHEATED STE The Mosquito turns into the steam wall for cover. Ashley follows, firing another blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! The sound of multiple phosphorous strik hitting the water are like thunder. Quinn smiles. He begins to puil up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By striking the water so many times, Ashley has created a FOGBANK. It's impossible to see within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley swoops blindly, skimming, listening for Quinn's pl The sound of the Mosquito gets farther...farther... It seems to be heading upward. Ashley stares up. Now's her chance. She begins to arc up out of the fog bank...  123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sees...nothing. The plane's DISAPPEARED. But the buzzing is now getting louder. It's then she-noti

dialogues.speaker: THE MOSQUITO
dialogues.text: arcing hundreds of feet above her UPSIDE DOWN. It's at 12:00, EXECUTING a wild LOOP over the dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a last desperate move, Quinn, upside down, guides the plane back over the dragon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late, Ashley realizes what Quinn is doing. The Mosquito is now diving BEHIND the dragon. Its loop no is accelerated by its descent. At the 7:00 point, it begins to PULL UP with huge speed. What happens next is so quick, it's nearly simultaneous.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: opens the canopy of his plane.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: tries to dive.

dialogues.speaker: THE MOSQUITO
dialogues.text: arcs upward.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: releases his belt and is sucked from the cockpit. SLAM! He hits the water at an angle at a savage 70 miles hour. His body SKIPS LIKE A STONE over the ocean just as

dialogues.speaker: THE MOSQUITO
dialogues.text: is carried in its course by the force of its acceleration ..-heading right into Ashley's egg-filled stomach.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: tries to avoid it, but

dialogues.speaker: THE MOSQUITO
dialogues.text: strikes home, SLAMMING INTO HER BELLY. Ashley's stomach EXPLODES! AND THE GREAT DRAGON IS LITERALLY RIPPED IN TWO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn recovers his sense barely in time to see

dialogues.speaker: A SHOCK WAVE
dialogues.text: from the blast, swelling right towards him. s QUINN

dialogues.speaker: HIT
dialogues.text: He dives just as the WAVE hits him full on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn is jostled to and fro under the wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fiery remains of the dragon fall from the sky like ra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his last strength, Quinn kicks with all his might to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn breaks the surface, GASPING for air. The water around is filled with burning debris. And there, not ten yards away, floats THE ASHLEY'S SEVERE HEAD. Bobbing lifeless as it sinks. Quinn watches it, sees himself reflected in the cornea of one eye, just as he had seen himself as a child. Soon, the reflection and eye and the last of the dragon disappear under the water. HOLD ON the burning debris

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burning debris CROSSFADES into BOATS. All shapes and size filled with refugees heading toward the coast of England

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a pile of dragon eggs arranged in a huge PIT in ground.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE IN THE HOLE
dialogues.text: An explosive charge DETONATES in the middle of the pit, reducing the their embryos to lifeless shreds. PULL BACK TO REVEAL Creedy supervising a CREW OF MEN AND WOMEN in the orderly disposal of remaining dragon eggs. PULL BACK FURTHER to reveal the rest of the park. A myria of TENTS are pitched throughout the park. A CARAVAN full new arrivals are busy preparing a campsite. TUFTS OF GREEN GRASS speckle the blackened hills. There's even a bit of sunlight peeking through the clouds. PAN OVER to a distant hill where a lone figure stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Quinn standing before what looks like a rough milita graveyard. British flags fly from some; The American from others. The dead in the war with Ashley. Quinn kneels down by one that flies the DON’T TREAD ON ME early American flag with the snake. It's there he places flask he took from Van Zan in the boat.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He actually stole that flask from me. Quinn turns to see Colleen behind him. No longer wearing flight suit, but a dress that covers her arms and legs. Quinn smiles.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: French delegation's here. They want to talk about an expedition to retake the continent.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: You wanna be in on it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Do you? Quinn shakes his head, looks down at the grave.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: Guess we owe it to him to keep fightin’.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Just him, huh? She nods at Beth and a group of the castle kids, playing soccer nearby.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: Won't exactly be a cakewalk. They say there's at least four of 'em in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: QUINN
dialogues.text: That's not what bothers me, Col. (Looks at her.) What if Van Zan was wrong about Ashley? What if there still other females? What do we do then? Colleen takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN
dialogues.text: We live. Hearing his own words thrown back at him, Quinn has to sm He kisses her gently, puts his arm around her. They walk together from the graveyard. Toward a city being reborn.
